Reviews.Author: Alan D.
Reviews.Content: I MEAN... yeah it's OKAY.But goddamn it's pretty expensive for something so... mediocre. It just doesn't seem worth the money you know? Because okay, I ordered a chicken sandwich, and I expected something a bit more, but not only did it come out like.... 15 minutes later, it came out really plain and boring.But let's not dwell on that negative. I want to focus on the positives. The alcohol, their specials on alcohol, and the fact that somehow, someway they make it taste so much better.Overall though, I honestly thought this would be an amazing place to eat when I was still in college because it was near THE SCENE... and it just looked like the typical college burger joint that everyone goes to.Unfortunately, I was left disappointed, but not let down. I got what I expected (at the last minute) and it was just MEH.

Reviews.Author: Samantha M.
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast. I don't know how to say it in a nice way but the place smelled like a bathroom like they used the same mop water to mop the toilets and then the dining area. I know, I still ate there though. We sat at a booth. Note the seats were ripped. I do, however, like the diner decor and think this place has major potential since it is in a popular and up and coming area of downtown SJ. You order at the counter and they bring it to your table. I ordered the "Belgian Waffle" combo which came with a choice of bacon or sausage. I chose bacon. Got my order and was extremely disappointed because this was NOT a fresh waffle-it was a frozen waffle (like eggo). It was a large belgian waffle cut in quarters. It was cold and some of the pieces were burnt AND cold. I thought I could over look it with a little butter and syrup but It was so hard I couldn't even finish two slices. Bacon was thin and a little chewy.  My total for breakfast was about $10 for Belgian waffle, bacon, and water :(This place could be amazing.

Reviews.Author: Brittany L.
Reviews.Content: How are there not 0 stars?- dirty - horrible food ~worst service in San Jose. San Pedro - shut these jerks down! How is this place still open and these people have jobs? Stay AWAY ...

Reviews.Author: Kaleena S.
Reviews.Content: The place was empty but my boyfriend and I decided we wanted a cheap burger (compared to others in the area). Now I know why it was empty. Worst hamburger I've ever had. I got a veggie burger which tasted like a frozen turned burnt patty, dry bun and no flavor whatsoever. The curly fries were good but expensive and fries cost extra. The beer was an okay deal. That's what the two stars are for.Overall, it's way overpriced for such a shitty burger. Mayo in a packet and pickles in a plastic container is just so lazy. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Paulina D.
Reviews.Content: Crap diner with overpriced crap food and godawful service. You're better off going inside San Pedro Square Market for overpriced food truck-style noms. At least those stands will treat you like a human being. And the ambiance is much nicer.

Reviews.Author: Daniel L.
Reviews.Content: So I found out why no one is ever in here. The food is horrible and the service is worse. They messed up my order twice and got defensive/rude when we just asked for a refund on the burger since we didn't want to wait another 20 minutes. Just avoid

Reviews.Author: Kait P.
Reviews.Content: This place was a total bust! My boyfriend and I decided to come here because we've had been to this restaurant chain before and it's yummy. However, this place in general, was awful. My boyfriend tried to get water from the soda machine but it wasn't water that came out. It was like a sour sprite gone bad. Then, we waited for our food. Both of the meals were supposed to come with fries but nobody brought them to us. We didn't even try asking the employees for some because of how bad our food tasted. I had the french dip which was basically meat put between two buns. There was no flavor and half of my bun was missing. The sauce was bad and even my iced tea had an awful flavor. It was overpriced and not worth the trip. Atmosphere gets an A+; food gets an F.

Reviews.Author: Hunny J.
Reviews.Content: This place blows. Frozen patties. Frozen everything. At least there's alcohol. I don't think I've ever had a shittier burger w a cold bun. Wayyyyy overpriced fries. I'd rather eat at mc Donald's. Two bites and I felt like I was chewing on cardboard.  If there were a zero star option, they wouldn't even deserve that. Really 40 bucks for two shitty burgers, cheap fries and Stella. Never again!

Reviews.Author: Tom B.
Reviews.Content: Very rude customer service. I ordered chili cheese fries and when I asked to split in half because they did not offer anything smaller, she rolled over her eyes. Also I ordered it to go. I waited at outside tables for my order which quite took long just for fries (like 20 minutes) and when she finally brought containers, she did not put them in a bag though it was order to go. When I asked about it, she rolled over her eyes again and told me to get it inside because they're too busy. The waitress seemed to be  a young immature HS/college age spoiled brat. The food was mediocre in quality and relatively overpriced at $6.50. Soggy and wet. It was not spicy at all but bland just with beans and melted cheese. Definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Author: Greg O.
Reviews.Content: Decent burger with decent fries. Open to midnight and a short walk from the Hilton. All my love all my kisses.

Reviews.Author: Jay E.
Reviews.Content: My buddy ordered a pitcher of beer & we didn't get it till 15-20min later!!! By far the longest wait to get beer & it taste it like crap!! Very bad service. This happen on USA vs Ghana World Cup match.

Reviews.Author: Brittany D.
Reviews.Content: Typical american dinner with James Dean, Elvis, Frank Sinatra, Marilyn Manroe on the walls. I just fell in love with the decor! I mean who wouldnt right?? Theres plenty of seating here, altough the times I've came hardly anyone here. The menu has tons of items you can choose from, I must say they serve breakfast, lunch/dinner.For just a regular chicken sandwich, 7.99 plus tax!! Not including any fries nor drink. Regular fries are over 2 bucks and the fountain drinks are 2.39..thats just crazy! so in total I spend over 15 bucks plus tip....=/I'm sorry but for some regular diner food, it should not be that much.

Reviews.Author: Tiana M.
Reviews.Content: We went here during Fanimecon and it was delicious. They have great food and a really big menu selection. The service was average and the restaurant was pretty crowded. The prices are also pretty average.

Reviews.Author: Allison F.
Reviews.Content: Not sure if the ownership has changed here but the quality of the food has gone down dramatically while the prices have gone up quite substantially.I would always order a preset combination lunch that was generally good for a steak sandwhich and the prices for the meal was $8.99.  The prices is now $12.99 but the quality of the meat has gone down, less toppings offered, and the overall flavor has changed beacuse of the quality of the ingredients.I am telling myself to never go back.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C.
Reviews.Content: Peggy sues is... fine.  Their fries are great if not a little expensive... especially when you get into the "fancy ones." How steak fries became fancy I'll never know. They have what I like to call "correct" ranch which makes me incredibly happy. And everything else is basic diner fare...plus a bar.  (Their shark tank is sugary. Their car bombs are large. And their coronas are cheap.) I'm not sure I believe it when they say "World's Best Milkshake" but some vanilla ice cream and espresso goes a long way. Unfortunately the food takes WAY too long. I've been here enough times to know this wasn't a one time thing. 20 minutes for fries? An extra 10 when they gave me the wrong soup. Too much...

Reviews.Author: Julia C.
Reviews.Content: Yes the shark tank is huge, but its size is its only redeeming factor. A huge percentage is syrup. Basically sugar with a light drizzle of alcohol and some lime to garnish. This place is fun to hang out at, prior to a sharks game. Especially with a great people watching view that comes with out door seating. Just don't come here if you're actually hungry. The chicken and fries are like soggy cardboard with out seasoning.

Reviews.Author: Dan D.
Reviews.Content: Wow, very disappointing. Peggy Sue's has been my pregame (San Jose Sharks) spot for over a decade, but the sentimental value is starting to wear thin.My dad and I stopped by for lunch before the Sharks game today. A few things that we noticed...1. Price has increased significantly (now $8.99 for a Chubby Checker WITHOUT fries or a drink)2. Both burgers were WAY overcooked 3 .Chili = canned Dennison 4. Isn't the cheese on the "cheese fries" supposed to be melted?I wish management would actually READ these reviews. Please stop cutting corners and give us back the old Peggy Sue's!

Reviews.Author: Brett R.
Reviews.Content: If you're into a crowded joint with average food, broken toilets, $7 burgers that don't include fries, your wife getting the shits after and you waking up with a stomach ache, totally come here. you'll love it.

Reviews.Author: Madisyn P.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the mango milkshake and my fiancé had the root beer float. The ice cream was definitely subpar and overpriced. The mango milkshake tasted not like the fruit at all, very fake. We will not go here again.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer T.
Reviews.Content: Why does yelp not have a 0 star option?DO NOT EAT HERE!!! My 2 coworkers really wanted a burger and nothing opened until 11:30AM, so we went to Peggy Sue's. I wish I checked into the place on my Yelp app BEFORE ordering and not after.The burger looked like something that came out of the microwave. The patty was the thinnest patty I had every seen and it tasted like a mixture of hot dog and some unknown meat - definitely not beef.The food here is so gross I don't even know how it's still open to this day. So gross, so gross, so gross.....ugh....i shudder just thinking about how I even managed to eat some of the burger.....

Reviews.Author: Carlos L.
Reviews.Content: My favorite drink is Shark Tank. Great drink overall and good value for $12. Will come back for one to pre-game for sharks game at the tank. Swerve was great for a drink , didn't get food but those burgers did look tasty.

Reviews.Author: c t.
Reviews.Content: 1. Bad lighting.If you like to eat in your cubicle, you might like eating here.2. Outdated, tacky atmosphere.If you like eating in a gift shop on Pier 39, you might like eating here.Those are my two biggest complaints about this restaurant. You can tell that the people that run it are trying, but trying in the wrong/cheap direction. San Pedro Square is growing more sophisticated, so why not renovate and make this place the best burger place on the square? It settles for 'good enough.' I still get take-out here periodically so that I can eat it at bars nearby that don't serve food.  But dine-in? No way.

Reviews.Author: Braden K.
Reviews.Content: surprised I haven't stopped by this spot earlier..after hitting up blush and san pedro square on weekend nights, we usually stumble over to temple. this particular night one of my buddies found it appropriate to check out the GOLD CLUB on the way so I figured i'd need a snack to get myself ready for the itty bitty yitties club, 'know what I mean?!I ordered a hamburger, it was a bit pricey and the meat was overcooked. It was slightly too tough and even a little burnt.correct me if i'm wrong but a hamburger shouldn't have cheese, so it should have a bit more mayonnaise to compensate and keep the burger moist?the burger was SUPER DRY like that japanese jacket store at valley fair.

Reviews.Author: Patrick L.
Reviews.Content: I took one of my employees to a Sharks game last night and asked him to choose the dinner spot - Peggy Sue's got the nod.  Geez kid, could you have picked a crappier place? The burgers were blah, fries tasteless and beers not cold.  Unimpressive performance, Peggy Sue.  Maybe Peggy Sue got married and left the restaurant to her unskilled sister to run...?  2 stars.

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: This place is the definition of "subpar."Well, they have nice TV's.  And the bar is pretty large.  But that's the only thing that's good about this place.When I ordered the Hot Rod, a burger with pepper jack and bacon, the cashier didn't know what I was talking about until I pointed it out. Hello?  Please learn your own menu.  I also got the garlic fries.  Service was fairly quick, but it didn't really matter.  The burger came with two thin slices of bacon (not even folded over to, you know, fit on the patty), a mess of plain jack cheese (thankfully melted), one tomato, a patty that was in no way 1/3lbs, and half a piece of lettuce.  Seriously?  WHO SKIMPS ON LETTUCE?  AND WHERE'S MY ONION?  The fries also strangely enough arrived on a second plate, but which also devoid of any garlic whatsoever.   It smelled like garlic, but when eaten they were just undercooked, soggy, and lacking garlic flavor.  That, for 4.95?  When the burger was 6.50?  Uh, pass.To top it all off, there is another Peggy Sue's on Park Avenue and the food in their pictures look SO SO much better (they give you an onion, at least, and fries are in a basket).  Whereas after eating here, I have to say I feel robbed.1.5 Stars.

Reviews.Author: Emily G.
Reviews.Content: The food reminds me of food from my local mom and pop diner from back home. It's good but nothing too special, especially for the prices. The cashier was very friendly and gave us great recommendations on our drinks. The Shark Tank 32oz margarita is delicious!

Reviews.Author: Julie K.
Reviews.Content: Save your money and health don't eat here.  Ghost town when we walked in...that should have been a clue.   We ordered two burgers with fries and onion rings. The meat was not of beef, i think maybe it was rat meat.  Holy shat, how can they serve this as real beef?  We both took one bite and sent it back.  The guy (75 years old) told us nobody has ever complained before, but reluctantly refunded our money then would not validate our parking because we only paid for the onion rings and soda ($7), and he told us we had to spend at least $10.   I remember Peggy Sues when they used to serve Beef on the their buns....rip peggy sue.

Reviews.Author: Clarissa Y.
Reviews.Content: I came here on the best day of my life, but Peggy Sue's did very little to help the fact.Why was it the best day of my life then?THE MRS. CARTER WORLD TOUR!!!My boyfriend and I were wandering around near the HP Pavilion hoping to find a decent place to find some food before heading over to the Beyonce concert and ended up at Peggy Sue's. Unfortunately, my phone no longer had any data and was unable to access Yelp otherwise I would've skipped the trip.Atmosphere:A tad bit tacky and overly "American", but it had its own strange charm to it. They have 2 large flatscreen TVs as well as I believe one other smaller one near the bar. Customer Service:The Indian woman was unenthusiastic, but we were also served by a chubby man who looked maybe Mexican or Filipino - he was very nice and a bit overly enthusiastic when my boyfriend ordered a pint of Guinness. "Yeahhh! Guinness!! My man!" Lmfao okay buddyy...Food:Here's the downer. I ordered Buffalo Wings and they were god awful. I am 95% certain that the buffalo sauce was nothing but tabasco sauce. It was overly spicy (neither my boyfriend or myself could handle it, and I'm normally pretty good with spice) and like I said, didn't taste like buffalo sauce. It just tasted like chicken in tabasco. Old, frozen chicken at that.Very disappointing considering it was the best day of my life and the meal I had was chicken I couldn't finish. The food was 1 star, but it was brought up by the friendly service and it was a decent place to hang out and kill a bit of time before the show.

Reviews.Author: Winnie G.
Reviews.Content: Meh. I mean the reviews are true, but I had a blast here. Being just about the only customer alongside with my roommate for one of our nights about town. We headed to Peggy Sues mainly for their Shark Tanks! But decided we might as well grab something to eat and kill some time. I wasn't expecting their food to be anything close to delicious, but I was pleasantly surprised. The bar tender/waiter/cashier/guy was so cool. He talked to us the entire time, made our drinks with an extra spike and he really was a great guy even when it was so dead on the inside. We opted for a bacon cheese burger with added avocado for all about 8 dollars total and two Shark Tanks (10). The Shark Tanks are basically 32oz of margarita that has 3 shots of either tequila or vodka, 2 shots of triple sec, lime juice and premium blue curacao syrup and their very special sweet and sour mix with salted rim and a lime wedge. It was the most legit drink of my life and it hit me really good. It's the best thing at Peggy Sue's. It's one of those things that you can only get here, in SJ, at PS, so you have to try it out. The burger was actually really juicy, though small in portion and not enough, but it was all the elements of a simple burger that was cooked right. We got bored so we ordered some garlic fries- which weren't garlic enough but the fries were done really well. Crispy, so we choked down most of it with adding ketchup. They actually offer seven different kinds of fries, so your options are endless. Walking into Peggy Sue's it's literally one of those been here since before time from the fifties diner that has all the posters, and the pictures and drawings and everything to give it that homey feel. Glad they're here. Take credit, valdate parking over 10$ purchase and indoor and outdoor seating AND their tv's have cable for all the sports going on. Go here if you trying to find a quiet place to drink and watch sports!

Reviews.Author: Aureliano C.
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the flat screens, early Hollywood era memorabilia, and the $12 Sharkbowl margaritas. Only 2 beers on tap. Ordered the double cheeseburger called The Chubby Checker and apparently didn't notice that after 2pm there are no combos available. It's all a la carte. I still ordered the combo fries and VANILLA shake that my son asked me for.The kid who took my order brought us a CHOC shake after I confirmed my order w him because he failed to repeat my order to me before ringing me up. He was too preoccupied w a group of girls sitting at the bar. Chubby Checker would be pissed to be named after such a shitty burger!  It was super tough and of a poor quality meat. Flavorless & over cooked. Was like a cardboard & cheese sandwich. Sorry guys. But bein as I am spoiled by better burgers up north I gotta give it 2 thumbs down. And that is very hard to make me give a place that score. I'm usually lenient.

Reviews.Author: Leslye S.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's food is simply okay.  Nothing special but not terrible.  Came here on a Sat. Afternoon and the restaurant was disgustingly dirty.  Came with a co-worker from New York and she even said it was dirtier than any place in NYC she had ever been to.  Only reason I would come back is free validation with any purchase on weekends.  I think this alone is what is keeping this place busy.

Reviews.Author: Ben H.
Reviews.Content: I'm always happy here drinking and eating with friends or by myself. You can't the prices on beer and food anywhere else on the street or in downtown for that matter. Unlike the other bars in the area you can rest assured no riffraff will be present here, this place flies under the radar due to the look of a diner but it's a great drinking spot that's open late everyday.

Reviews.Author: Fernando V.
Reviews.Content: Topical American dinner, with their food overly priced with no flavor and terrible service.The only good thing is their coffee. I probably wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Author: Bill M.
Reviews.Content: Hadn't been in a long time and I forgot how bad it was.  We were in the neighborhood and just dropped in for an early dinner.  I'm not sure anything we ordered was up to McDonald's quality.  The chicken in the chicken sandwiches was tired and fatty.  All of our buns were super dry.  The kids' chicken nuggets tasted like some non-chicken product.  I can't wait for my next meal to get the taste out.If the bad quality isn't convincing enough, the prices are ridiculous.  One of our kids wanted a hot dog and they didn't have a kids' meal with a hot dog, so we paid $7 for a hot dog, $5 for a side of fries and $3.50 for a milk.  I hope I don't make this mistake again for a very long time.

Reviews.Author: Khanh T.
Reviews.Content: I always stumble into this place in the wee hours of the night.Would I ever eat here sober? Absolutely not! Small portions, food is OK at best, and way way overpriced.Btw, I've had the most disappointing fish and chips of my life here. :(

Reviews.Author: Sherry M.
Reviews.Content: We ate here for the first and last time!  We ordered 2 burgers w/fries, 2 kids grilled cheese plates, 2 apple juices, 1 iced tea and 1 shot of fireball.  All that was $70!!  WTF?!  Now if the quality of the food was better then maybe I wouldn't complain as much but Costco's frozen burger patties are even better!  Not to mention we ordered our food at 6:58pm and got our food at 7:40pm.  It wasn't even that busy!  The server apologized but still!  Not going back there again!  We woulda been happier spending $30 at Popeyes!

Reviews.Author: Tamika B.
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd try something new. Amazing drinks! Huge burgers and loaded chili cheese fries. Shrimp and chips too!

Reviews.Author: Molly M.
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming factor about this place was the milk shakes, and even then, they were sub-par and somewhat expensive compared to that of a simple In-N-Out burger or some other fast food restaurant.I really liked the interior, since I'm a sucker for retro, so I guess that's something if some people like novelty over food . The decorations and furnishings are reminiscent of Red Robin, but the food is waaaaaaaayyyy worse. I ordered a regular bacon cheese burger and some regular, plain fries. Pretty hard to screw up, right?The patty was disgusting. It was bland and tasted overly-processed like a cheap microwaveable patty available at any grocery store for 75% less than what you pay here. The quality of the food does NOT correspond with the price at all, and my friends and I were rather disappointed. We wont be back next time we visit San Jose.

Reviews.Author: Esmeralda M.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times before and it was a cool place to go and dine in. I went this thursday and as soon as we got to order our food I asked the cashier guy(owner ) how big their Caesar salad was... he walked away 3x during my order without saying excuse me . I can eat alot he said it was a good size and big enough. My bf ordered a burger and curly fries. The bacon was so thin and gross looking. The fries were the best out of both our meals. My 'good size salad' was big enough for a 4 year old to eat. Ridiculous!! I will give 4 stars to the shark tank drink. Mine was great. I asked for tequila. My bf asked for vodka and his didnt even taste like it had alcohol in it. The guys who work there need to pick up their pants too because they're all sagging. Probably last time I go there

Reviews.Author: Thomas B.
Reviews.Content: What happened to this place!haven't been here in a long time, but i remembered they had great burgers.Used to be thick , juicy patties. basically all around good burger and delicious fries.To put it bluntly, the burgers are revolting. Thin, dried out patties. The meat looked like mystery meat, probably made from left over parts, (ears and a**holes). Bun was dry, bacon was mummified. I'm kinda mad i spent 7 bucks on it, could made some at home or gone to sliders on san carlos.If you absolutely have to eat here, get a basket of fries and one of they're 32oz beers. Only good thing in the joint!

Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: Cute little diner open till 2am! Garlic fries and shakes! Right down the street from the Wagon, close by and great for when you get the munchies!

Reviews.Author: Shawn F.
Reviews.Content: We visited this place after a San Jose Sharks game. Two burgers and one order of fries. The place was 1/3 full. 40 minutes later we were still waiting for the burgers. The staff had lost the order. It took over 1 hour for the food. The manager did nothing to make the situation right. He looked at his camera system and found out his staff have the burgers to some drunk people at another table. We will NEVER come here again!

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: I went here to have a late dinner with my girlfriend and brother because it was the only place open where we can eat a decent meal. However, we deeply regret going there. If there was a negative star rating I would give it because this place doesn't deserve a star. The quality of the food was bad and overpriced. Don't bother ordering the apple pie because it's a piece of small shit. They charged me 6$ for a piece of small crap which tasted very bland. The garlic fries were horrible because they were soggy and didn't have that much garlic making it bland.   In addition, I paid $5.50 for the fries and they give a little plate of "sad" fries. Overall, If there was a 7Eleven near there you should go there instead because they sell better quality food and more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Author: Katherine C.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a late night post-bar hopping meal here. Pretty standard American food. We had their curly fries, onion rings and cheeseburgers. Really good. I love their onion rings. They were incredibly crispy, and the onion doesn't drag out of the breading.Good service, friendly staff. I think it'll be my go-to place for onion rings.

Reviews.Author: Chuck B.
Reviews.Content: Such a sad place.  This is not the classic burger-and-shake joint that you want it to be.The food is maybe OK, on a good day.The staff is laconic and aloof.The space is dirty, beaten, and cluttered.Take, for instance, the silverware.  They offer  actual metal spoons and forks but only plastic knives (they have a tersely handwritten "For mayo only!" under them).There are ragged paper signs taped to the wall, rips in the seat vinyl, throbbing music playing in the afternoon on a weekday (while all of their visitors are just trying to watch Stanford play in the Rose Bowl.)Here's the gist of it: they don't care about you.  They also don't understand that people want this to be a classic burger joint.  Nobody wants crappy neon bud light signs or miserable inkjet printed ads plastered everywhere.Peggy Sue, get your act together, you owe us "the world's best shake".

Reviews.Author: Kivani R.
Reviews.Content: Well, I tried Peggy Sue's for the first time last weekend. And I hate to say it but I wasn't too impressed. I sort of expected more from this place because of all the rave about it. Burger and Fries were less than mediocre (the quality of their beef patty's were as terrible as it gets). And the place definitely needs a make-over. Im thinking "Restaurant Impossible"?

Reviews.Author: Tess H.
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. My boyfriend and I stopped by here before a Sharks game. Definitely not what I expected, in the WORST way possible. The server was incredibly rude- when giving us our food, he just dropped the plate in front of us, dropping a couple of fries on the table, without even apologizing. Then, I asked for a knife, and when he came back, instead of handing me the knife, like a decent waiter would, he just threw it on the table and left. Now for the food, I ordered a bacon cheeseburger, but you're seriously better off getting a burger from McDonald's. Trust me- this is not an exaggeration. Don't go here unless you're looking to waste your time and money.

Reviews.Author: Kenny K.
Reviews.Content: Been coming here for years before sharks games but in the last year or so, they jacked up the prices. Cashiers are not good about communicating add ons that are extra. Sharks special used to be $8 and now it's $13.

Reviews.Author: Susie O.
Reviews.Content: Came here for breakfast and now we know to never come back. Food tasted like the oil/grease they use to cook the food in, we ate stale bread, and old fruit. However, the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Author: Jack T.
Reviews.Content: - Got order wrong even after clarifying- Food itself was not great- Just not good execution considering what it isCame with a friend and was not expecting much and they still had trouble satisfying that. Here's a specific example of what I think is wrong with this place: Fries.A burger joint should know how to do fries. The fries were awful. Soggy and gross. Places that do not specialize and have been open for months manage to get this right. Why can not they see this? And that's my point.Edible but I do not recommend at all. Any of the San Pedro eateries do food better and I think you can find better qualified burger joints elsewhere for sure.On the positive side, it's not super expensive.

Reviews.Author: Joe Y.
Reviews.Content: I always hate when someone starts out a review by writing:I can't believe all the poor reviews for this placeHowever:I can't believe all the poor reviews for this place!!Most of the complaints seem to be how long the wait is when they're busy.  That should be a good sign that a place is popular.  If their burgers weren't good, why would there be a line??I sometimes work in the downtown SJ area.  I will walk a few blocks out of my way to get to Peggy Sue's.  My favorite burger is the Porky Pig.  Bacon and Cheddar added to a 100% Angus beef patty.  For a little extra charge, I ask to have Chili added to mine. AWESOME!!Peggy Sue's isn't upscale fine dinning.  It's American grub at a reasonable price.  There are over 40 kinds of sandwiches on their menu.  Something for everyone.  I'm hoping to stop in for breakfast someday.  The Peggy Sue omelet a local police officer was eating looked great.  Hey, if the police are eating here, it has to be good...

Reviews.Author: Bob V.
Reviews.Content: I have gone to Peggy Sue's prior to almost every San Jose Sharks hockey game since the 2005-2006 season.  What originally attracted me to Peggy Sue's was the very affordable drinks.  Before games, its the only place that I know of that sells a 32oz. beer for $6, however, the selection of 32oz beers is minimal (Hef, Sierra Nevada, Budweisser, and Bud Light), but where else can you find a beer of that magnitude at that price.  They also have other beers from the bottle.In addition to the very affordable beer...$3 kamikazes!  They also offer a variety of other mixed drinks that are reasonably priced.  My fiancee's favorite being a "Shark's Margarita" (a teal colored margarita) for $5.Ok, now I'm starting to sound like a frugal alcoholic so lets talk about the food.  I can understand a lot of the negative reviews due to the quality of food, but what do you expect when you can get anything for about $4-8.  If I feel like getting a quick bite before the game, I'll just settle for the usual diner food such as a hot dog, hamburger, or wings with fries.  I see a lot of families where they appear to be enjoying milk shakes...I haven't tried those yet.Location is pretty nice.  You can park at the San Pedro Garage before games for $3, walk across the street to the diner, and its a short 10 minute walk with a bunch of other fellow fans to the arena.Bottom Line: I'm more than satisfied with this place for the cheap drinks and food before every game I attend.  The staff is always friendly and will remember your name after visiting a few times.  Go there before Sharks games!

Reviews.Author: Mikey U.
Reviews.Content: It was late in the day (Sunday of the San Jose Jazz Festival) and I started to get hungry. As I walked through San Pedro Square, a sidewalk sign caught my eye: in big bold letters, "$1.50 Pabst Blue Ribbon on tap!"I'm easy. In I went.The girl tending to the register was very patient, dealing with a squad of ill-mannered ruffians ahead of me, then [still] pleasant and friendly, if a little exasperated, when it came my turn to order. Smiling service?  "+1".The thick 50's diner veneer of rock'n'roll memorabilia and posters of classic Hollywood imagery sets a casual and light hearted mood.  The abundance of SJ Sharks paraphernalia reminds that you are in modern Silicon Valley.  Vintage black and white nostalgia and crisp black and teal fandom; the place has lots of flash, now if only the food had a little more flare...They've a lengthy lunchtime menu: burgers, hot and cold sammiches, hotdogs, and a few baskets of deep fried whatsits.  "+1" for being able to substitute any burger with turkey, chicken, or Gardenburger.  For a place with a couple "best of"s under their belt (Wave, Metro, though not recently), you'd think they'd sizzle up phenom-nomage; but I didn't find anything worth raving about...Someone needs to apply a touch-up to the carhop girl/statue._______________$1.50 PBR... what can I say?"Can I have another?" and "+1".Told you, I'm easy.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer W.
Reviews.Content: I have nothing against Peggy Sue's. It's just an ordinary diner with the black and white tiled floor and decent prices. What I like is that it's open super early. Being in downtown San Jose, I've often found myself hunting for a place to grab a bite early in the morning. Peggy Sue saved me from Starbucks several times.Most memorable thing: the springy red cushion seats at the booths. seriously, you'll jump up as soon as someone plops down next to you!

Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: This place should really be taken to task for its blatant false advertising as there is a sign promising "The best hamburger in the world".  I'm not sure which world they are referring to, perhaps the world of prison food, for the tasteless hockey puck of a burger that they served up did not live up to the obvious hype.I was suspicious how quickly our order arrived.  The burger looked like it had been cooked some hours ago and kept on a warm part of the grill and then served up.  It tasted about the same, a mass of grey meat in a spongey bun.  The fries were the saving grace, but they were obviously frozen so I don't think they can lay credit to those.  Frozen aside they were crispy and tasty.Gah, I'm still kicking myself for walking past Amici's and going to this craphole.

Reviews.Author: Sarah J.
Reviews.Content: I want to give Peggy Sues more stars, I really do. Peggy forgive me, don't sue! (Ha, I've broken the pun ice Yelpers...it's all downhill from here)The strawberry milkshake was the hangover cure of choice for meself and hubby when we lived nearby in San Ho. It really is the bees knees, the cat's whiskers and the dog's testicles. The food was greasy diner fare, again perfect for booze-addled bods on a Sunday but... my major gripe with this place is the complete lack of atmosphere. Good grief, sell off the feckin jukebox and buy a few tumbleweeds and be done with it. Even on a bright, sunny weekend lunchtime on what could be construed as a bar and restaurant 'strip', there was never much life. Shame. People don't know when they're well off. Think of those poor starving Irish children...starved of a bit of sunshine...and fabulous milkshakes. Sniff...

Reviews.Author: Warren W.
Reviews.Content: "Don't they do anything here?"My friend complains as we sit in a booth and he thinks a waitress will show up to take his order. He says it again as we sit down and we hear our order called. Yes, we have to get up and pick it up from the counter as well. It was totally dead too at 2pm, wouldn't have killed the cashier gal to do something for us. We even tipped her right after the order. It really is self-serve here. The food is simple and fair enough. You can't really screw up a burger worse than McDonald's. For the veggie inclined, THERE IS a veggie burger. Their "Garden Burger." =) hOWEVER, there are so many superior vegetarian restaurants in the immediate vicinity that the only sole reason to eat here is cause it's close to the parking garage and you have a friend that must have a burger. Besides that, it's chill, it's simple. Nothing too impressive. Just a straight up 50's dinner. Self-service feel = minus 2 stars.The staff are pretty cool however. But yea, the 50s rock got to out of control haha, had to sit outside and enjoy the sounds of the street. ;)

Reviews.Author: CW P.
Reviews.Content: I started working my way down the The Classics menu at Peggy Sue's last season, and I'm still working my way down this season.  I have only eaten somewhere else before a Sharks game once and that was because my friend was a vegetarian.  The reason? Free parking at the San Pedro Square garage, proximity to the Arena, and decent burgers.  The burgers are not huge, which leaves room for Peggy Sue's shakes or dippin dots at the Arena. They are not greasy, and the themed burgers, like the Rocky and the Blue Hawaiian, fit the cute diner theme.  I recommend the chocolate shake.The fries are nothing special.  Finally, I'm not an expert on family friendly dining, but I suspect this would be a good place for parents who want their kids to associate diner food and kitsch with hockey games.  That seems more special than a Happy Meal and Golden Arches before the game.

Reviews.Author: Brando Calrissian ..
Reviews.Content: :/ I went to Peggy Sue's tonight because of the other reviews on this page. Im not sure what type of food they are used to eating but the 4 and 5 star reviews are NOT deserved.Dont get me wrong, this isnt a bad place and the food is ok. Problem is the food is just ok. Everything tastes like the random baseball field vendor or american roach coach. In other words the frys / nuggets / onion rings / burgers are all frozen items purchased in bulk. Peggy Sues is only a diner becuase of the decoration. It even pales in comparison to chains like Jonny Rockets, Mels Drive Through or Dennys.If I found this place on my own (without reading 4 and 5 star Yelp reviews) my only real complaint would be the wait time.If you want something good and cheap you are much better off atSonoma chicken coop across the streetLa Victoria around the corner (yum)Togos down the streetQuiznos around the corner

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is a local San Jose establishment and this store is located within the San Pedro Square area (right across the street from the parking garage).  The restaurant is self-service, and there are both indoor and outdoor seating.  I'm usually not a big fan of pseudo 50's diner, but the food turns out to be all right.  Keep your expectations low and you won't be disappointed by this place.    We got an Avocado Jack Burger for $5.75 and make it a combo by adding curly fries and a fountain drink for $2.55 more.  The burger is definitely not gourmet by any stretch of the imagination, but it isn't bad either.  The classic cobb salad (with grilled chicken, $7.35) turned out to be a better choice and feels somewhat healthier (unless you drench it in the bleu cheese dressing).  The grilled chicken on the salad is surprisingly moist and tender.   Bottom Line:  Decent portion size and nice atmosphere.  Good family friendly place.

Reviews.Author: Shehryar S.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming here for years on Sharks game nights. It used to be really good, but over the years I've noticed the quality going down. My girlfriend and I decided that after years of being Peggy Sue's customers, last night would be our last time there.I will say though that this is an awesome place to go for pre-game drinks. The deals are fantastic. Beer comes out to $3.50/pint on tap. They have huge 32oz  margaritas on the rocks that are $7.

Reviews.Author: Bob S.
Reviews.Content: If I hadn't been so hungry, I wouldn't have kept working to choke it down.The burger patties were dry, thin, tough, chewy, flavorless.The tomato slice had a big hard unripe core chunk.The lettuce was nice and crisp, and the roll was tasty and fresh.

Reviews.Author: Alan G.
Reviews.Content: Worst place on earth. Food is horrible, Owner is a complete idiot. I was there one night and the owner would not let anyone used the restroom and then he pushed a girl who tried to used it.  Never never ever go here.

Reviews.Author: Bobby l.
Reviews.Content: I ordered the 19b which is 3 hamburger pattys, chili, and an egg sunny side up.  And like every burger that has chili in it, all the chili goshes out =(  The burger was...just a burger.Nothing special.  The burgers are averaging $6 and usually doesn't include drinks or fries.  There are 2 TV screens to watch sports.  There are many burger variations, plus fish n chips, sandwiches, milkshakes.The location is a good location for the restaurant, but I feel that the food could use some work to make it stand out.

Reviews.Author: Ashley T.
Reviews.Content: I came here late at night bar hopping around Downtown San Jose with a few friends. We came here for a sharks tank cocktail. It's a huge glass, the size of my face filled with ice and booze. I saw him put a whole lot of alcohol in it, I can't remember what exactly but it really did the job. Everyone in my party ordered a sharks tank and we tried to race to see who would finish first. Too bad the place was dead empty, no audience to see me win. It tasted like a really tropical margarita. You can definitely taste the tequila, orange, and lemon taste to it. I think there was a berry taste to it as well. I cant remember. If you're curious. You should try it. It's a really good drink.Peggy Sue's is really dead at night which makes it fun to bring a big crowd because you know you'll have a seat and the music isn't loud at all. You guys can just sit around and catch up on drinks. The decor is of a classic 60's diner and there's a hot cut out of Marilynn Monroe by the bathroom. PHOTO TIME!

Reviews.Author: Maronita I.
Reviews.Content: I worked at O'Flaherty's for 3 years...We got our food from Peggy Sue's...It's standard diner food.. many options. The staff is friendly and helpful.They have daily specials. Sometimes they make their own soup, usually very good. But if you like clam chowder... its ssooooo good in the bread bowl... add some tabasco and you got a winner.They have a small area set up as a bar to fulfill the longing livers of thirsty patrons, beers on tap and tasty shakes.I'd rec. the chicken sandwich or cobb salad.They also have great breakfast prices.Great place for kids. Fun environment with lots to look at and music to jive to. Gets crazy on Shark game nights... so go early.

Reviews.Author: Lucy D.
Reviews.Content: Great place to get some simple American sandwiches and breakfast and conveniently right across the tech museum.  The make sandwiches with plenty of veggies and meats. I ordered a simple BLT and couldn't even finish it. The inside has a cute oldies atmosphere and service is super friendly. This place doesn't give out fries or any other side dishes with their entrée, but for about $3 more, you can get a huge basket of fries or garlic fries with plenty to share. And since their sandwiches are filling, there is no need to order extra side dishes.

Reviews.Author: Michael M.
Reviews.Content: This place would get one star if it wasn't for the crinkle fries. I had a cheese burger with bacon, fries and a bottle of water. The fries were great! Nice, crispy and delicious. Too bad the burger wasn't as good. The meat was thin, dry and looked like it was sitting in a box in the kitchen then tossed on the grill to warm up. The bacon was OK, but had burnt bits on it which suggests that it was cooked on a dirty grill. The buns were super thick, dry and really cancelled out any burger flavor. Overall, the burger experience was lame. There was nothing about it that made it stand out among other burgers. Seriously, had I known this place was this ignunt (bad) I would have just gone to McDonald's. Also I thought the bathroom was really dirty. First, the door leading to the bathroom was absolutely filthy! Right above the door knob, you can tell thousands of people put their hands there and leave a nasty area of dirt which is really easy to spot when the door is pearl white. Inside the men's room it was pigpen. The stall door is barely hanging on and doesn't even lock properly. I'd like to thank the man who sat in the next booth to me for confirming that while I was in there. Also, thanks for burping really loudly too. That just added to the already disgusting atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Russell S.
Reviews.Content: I've gone to Peggy Sues countless times since I first started eating here in 1996. When I was interning downtown, I ate here almost once  a week. Since then, I've always eaten here a few times before a Sharks game.The diner is 50's themed with decorations on the walls to match. There is also various sports memorabilia scatted across the walls and pillars. Almost every time I've gone, I've always stuck to the Sharks special. Two burger patties, cheese, bacon served on a roll with fries and a drink.  Why mess up a good thing?There is a side bar to fix your burger/sandwich up with all the fixings-ketchup, mustard, pickles, onions mayo etc.One of the best things about Peggy Sue's is the shakes. They are fantastic and come in a variety of flavors. I usually always go strawberry with the occasional chocolate. Two people can easily split one order. A shake is served in the glass and also a mixing cup that the shake was made in. If you plan to go here before a Sharks game, make sure to get there early. Seating can be tough to get either inside or outside.If you are not in the mood for a burger/sandwich, head across the street to a sister store, Sonoma Chicken Coop for pasta, chicken, salads etc.

Reviews.Author: Sara K.
Reviews.Content: We like Peggy Sue's as a reasonably priced family place when we are downtown.   Burgers are good & not so huge that you leave feeling overly full.  Fries & onion rings are fine, nothing special.  My husband & one kid RAVE about the milk shakes & malts & I'm a fan of their chili burger.Several years ago I was downtown on a Saturday morning & stopped in for breakfast.  They have a very simple breakfast sandwich (fried egg, bacon & cheese on sourdough toast) that is SO GOOD!  I was with a friend & we both loved them. Service is pretty good & the food comes fairly quickly as long as you aren't there before a Sharks game.

Reviews.Author: Lorrie M.
Reviews.Content: I can understand mixed reviews of this place but I personally have had tons of fun here and really enjoy their food. All of their creative burgers are flavorful and comes out freshly cooked with fresh, crisp ingredients that you can add to your burger such as pickles and lettuce. I love their hot dogs because they just taste so ... hot dog-ish LOL ... it's like when you want a hot dog, you want a Peggy Sue's hot dog!They have gigantic milk shakes that many of my friends love (I simply just don't like milk shakes haha but I think they're decent) and the prices are not too outrageous for the downtown area + 50's look and feel.The only downside to this place is that it's not all that clean ... but hey I'm grubbing on a burger, who cares :)

Reviews.Author: Steph V.
Reviews.Content: This diner is in an ideal location on San Pedro Square. Close to clubs, bars, the Shark Tank. If you're craving some good ol' burgers, shakes and fries in the area, stop on by to Peggy Sue's. They're open til midnight and won't kick you out if you're still eating past closing. I've been here a couple times. Here's my two cents:+ Lots and lots of seating. I'm talking booths, tables, counters for your rumps to take a load off. + Beer and adult beverages. You can enjoy an affordable pint of beer at a price slightly less than the surrounding businesses. + Cute music that fits in with the time era and decoration. 50's 60's boop bop+ Friendly staff. You'll get a smile even late at night+ Clean, clean!+ Try the banana shake! Made with real bananas :)+ Burgers are legit and pretty tasty with bacon+ Don't forget the fries!!So why the 3 stars? I don't think Peggy Sue's compares to the other diners in San Jose, but I do appreciate the fact that they are staying open and keeping up with the hussle and bussle of the downtown community. Cheers, Peggy!Tip: They share a bathroom with O'Flaherty's Irish Pub next door. Make sure you don't accidentally walk into the wrong restaurant after draining the main vein!

Reviews.Author: Sara W.
Reviews.Content: I really love breakfast and homey diners. There is that vintage feel with the old movie posters and 50's-ish setting. The food is reasonably priced; for two people, we get out paying $17 or so. I always get the Peggy Sue's omelet with no meat (I'm a vegetarian), and it's good every time, and sometimes too much food. Also, I work nearby and get the breakfast burrito for $2.50 frequently. I think the burrito is better than that from La Vic's because it's bigger, tastier, and more filling.

Reviews.Author: Will C.
Reviews.Content: Yikes! Which group voted Peggy Sue's best hamburgers in San Jose? Makes burger afficiandos think that folks from San Jose think Red Robin is the Ritz. Went here last night prior to Sharks game. Ordered the Peggy Sue's cheeseburger. Burger came out warm (not hot) with the usual cheese, tomato, lettuce. Mustard and Ketchup I had to add myself.Overall impressions:- meat is tasteless- meat is dry- buns taste store bought- I don't care if the beef is 100% angus beef if I am not enjoying how it tastes- staff seems nice enough. very quick to clean off your tables. seating, however, is limited during sharks game nights. - veggies and tomatoes taste fresh, but I don't order burgers for the veggies.

Reviews.Author: JoAnne M.
Reviews.Content: I agree wit Michael M.s description of the burger... thin dry and probably sitting in a box in the back waiting to be thrown on the grill. The one and only time I have been there (I won't go back) I had the worst burger of my life.The restroom made me feel like I was in the mens room of the dirtiest nastiest bar in the world.  I couldn't let my 3 yr old use the restroom there.There are MANY other restaurants in this area to choose from before a concert or Sharks game at the Pavillion.

Reviews.Author: Patricia A.
Reviews.Content: So I've lived in Santa Clara/San Jose all my life (44 years) and went to Peggy Sue's for the first time tonight because we went to Christmas in the Park.  What a disappointment!!  The food was about what you could get at any low rate diner. Not bad but not good. The service is really what prompted my bad review. First of all the lights were off outside so we weren't sure if we could walk in or not. Then the guy who was originally at the counter to take our order looked like he got frustrated because we didn't spout off an order right away (we had to look at the menu). He went back to the kitchen and sent a younger kid with no personality to take our order. After we ordered we looked for a clean table (at least 6 of the 10 or so tables were dirty) and sat down.  We saw the kid who took our order mop under a table with one arm and managed to push all the items under the table to the back of the wall, I guess that's considered clean there THEN he left the dirty mop up against the wall by all the tables. No one of the staff was identifiable and it seems like they are all thirsty as camels because they frequented the soda machine often, even with short lived rush we witnessed a couple employees walk out from the back to fill their cups.  We got our "over-priced" food - almost $50 for three of us and ate. The dirty tables that we saw when we got there were still there and patrons were bussing their own tables so they could sit down until the laziest looking girl came out with a bussing tub to start doing her job.  She started cleaning a table off for a couple ladies after suggesting that they sit at another "clean" table right by the door.  I'm surprised they are still in business, it seems like its a family own establishment now......I'm sure they don't get much return customers, just ones that happen to stumble in because they surely have a prime location - lucky for them.

Reviews.Author: Rufina M.
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is the location. Food was bland. Garlic fries were cold. When we went to the counter their response was "What - they're not warm?" On top of that, there was no garlic to be found on the fries! Got attitude when we asked them to validate our parking. Don't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Author: Black K.
Reviews.Content: I came here for a needed "pitstop" from the San Jose Jazz Festival. Although I was impressed by the decor, the food was ok. Nothing out of this world. I ordered a "Hot Rod" (Burger with Spicy Jack Cheese and Bacon) with Onion Rings and a Vanilla Milkshake.The shake was yummy. The rings were tasty. And the quality of the meat was on par. The only problem I had with the place-a big problem for a hungry man-is that the portions are sooooo small!Burger joynts in the Bay Area are a dime a dozen. There's one on every corner it seems like. And it seems like everyone of them have served much bigger portions than Peggy Sue's.One piece of advice, you have to self order your food. So don't stand at the front counter expecting to be seated by a hostess. And don't expect them bring the food to you either. Peggy Sue's is a self-serve organization. lol

Reviews.Author: Wilhelm Y.
Reviews.Content: I used to dine at Peggy Sue's quite often, but the quality of their food seems to be gradually going downhill.  Two visits ago I noticed that the bread on my burger was dry and not fresh.  It kind of just fell apart on its own.  It was around that time that they changed to the krinkle cut fries, and I don't know if its a different brand of frozen fries or bad oil.  I tend to prefer the meatier fries over the fast-food shoestring, but these krinkle cuts were not good.Prior to attending a Sharks game a friend had insisted that we eat here again.  I had a similar problem with crusty bread that could not hold up on its own, and the whipped cream (aerosol-dispensed) on my milkshake had a film on it.  Ugh!  To top the whole bad experience off a wicked chlorine-like smell in one corner of the restaurant left us and a few other patrons scrambling to other tables.Peggy Sue's use to be a great little diner with good burger combos.  It's unfortunate, but I can't think of anything good to say about it anymore.

Reviews.Author: Sherri C.
Reviews.Content: I am not a diner type of gal.  However, the ratings are much too low for Peggy Sue's at San Pedro Square.  Here are the reasons why:1)  Excellent location2)  Easy parking3)  One of the only diners I know of with a full bar4)  Quick turn-around on orders5)  Open for breakfast with breakfast items on the menu6)  Promos and Happy Hour7)  Incredibly nice and dedicated ownersAside from reasons #1 and #2, comparable restaurants -- like In-and-Out Burger -- offer even more limited variety.  They may both be "pick up your order at the counter" places, but Peggy Sue's menu is far more comprehensive with regard to food and beverage items.  I will admit I don't really come here for the food; for me, the appeal of Peggy Sue's is that it's a great informal place to meet up with others before a show or Sharks game, or to have internal work meetings with my team during the restaurant's less busy hours.  Having the kitchen and bar available when you are there for whatever purpose is a bonus (working out strategy for projects can make people really hungry and thirsty)!  One extra star for the interesting and historical memorabilia that decorate the walls of this establishment and provide a comfortable, traditional atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Wen C.
Reviews.Content: I place that sells nothing burgers should be able to turn out a damn good one.There is nothing special about Peggy Sues, their menu choices put you to sleep, nothing exciting or original here. Their burgers don't make an impact either, definitely no flavor explosion in my mouth . The quality of burger was also on the downside, the bun looked like the cheapest stuff u get at the supermarket. The portion was a lot smaller than most burgers you get everywhere else too.The only thing that tickled my fancy was the self-service condiment bar.

Reviews.Author: Nick W.
Reviews.Content: Love these burgers. Always great service, and never a crazy wait to get a table. The shark's special is my favorite, with a strawberry vanilla, or a banana vanilla milkshake. Do it!If I had one gripe, it would be that they leave the mayo out for you to help yourself at the condiment bar. Mayo is not something I like sitting out uncovered and non-fridgerated. Other then that, great place. Love the decor too.

Reviews.Author: Elea C.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is an old-fashioned American-style diner apparently frequented by the Sharks during hockey season. The decor is fun to look at -- with clippings of old newspaper articles, posters, autographed shirts, and other assorted memorabilia -- which is good, because the food usually takes a little while to prepare, even if there aren't that many customers. You stand in line to order, seat yourself, and then pick up your food from the counter, so Peggy Sue's really isn't a place to go if you're looking for the whole traditional dining experience. Their saving grace comes in the quality of their edibles -- I love the curly fries here, and the milkshakes are awesome. Still, I don't come too often because it can be a bit pricey in comparison to its portions, and I fall under the category of 'poor college student needing to live modestly'.

Reviews.Author: BeBe C.
Reviews.Content: This review is based on my last visit about 9 months ago. I recall that the burgers were quite good (my husband disagreed--he said they were just ok) while the milkshakes were excellent. The Pen Creamery in Palo Alto also offers great shakes but Peggy Sue's surely wins for the value.

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Mainly my review is based on the girls who work the register/call out the orders when they are done. Frankly, the food here is GREAT. I've never had an issues with it. The bartender is my favorite person ever and makes great drinks. However, the place should look into getting new people working the front.I understand that on game nights the place is PACKED. I know what that's like, at my job one of the days a week I have an hour to usually help 20 people. It sucks, but you get through it. Instead, the girl who was working last night was so frustrated and was showing it. Instead of listening to us order (even though she told us to order three times) she kept running around. Of coarse, even when I asked her to read the order back something was wrong. Oh boy.Once we got the food, another girl got into an argument with us about it being wrong. We ordered a turkey burger and a bacon burger. We ended up with two burgers. I told the girl this wasn't mine and she insisted I ordered wrong. Really? I don't eat red meat, so there is no way I ordered a hamburger, sorry there is no way. My receipt says turkey burger. What happened to the customer is always right?

Reviews.Author: Joe B.
Reviews.Content: We went to Peggy Sue's for lunch. The weather was great out. I was looking forward to a big juicy cheese burger. Too bad, i got my hopes up.I ordered a bacon cheese burger. It was ok. It wasn't great. Maybe a step up above Wendy's, but two to three times as expensive. The fries were awful and the onion rings were almost completely burned. The service was terrible. We must have stood in line for 6 to 8 minutes before they took our order. There was only two people in front of us. I can only imagine what it is like when the place is busy. The restaurant looks cool. They do sell beer and drinks. I might go try it again after work. I am not going ot write it off yet. There are so many restaurants in this part of San Jose that i don't want to settle..

Reviews.Author: Leo T.
Reviews.Content: Ambiance? It's dead....seriously. The burger's aren't THAT great in taste but they are above par when compared to chain places like JRocket's. Originality is at its best here for the names, but they really are just variations on a theme. It just doesn't cut it for all the reviews I've read. I eat big and they can provide BIG so there's a plus. But for the prices... not entirely worth it. When I think GREAT burgers, I think Five Brothers in Washington, D.C. (yeah, I go all over for burgers). Even Fuddruckers might be better... maybe even In-n-Out.. oh snap!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie B.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are cheap and you get what you pay for. It's not the best (Crepeville in Davis, CA), but it's not the worst I've ever tried (my own homemade burgers? lol)..Their shakes are really good though. Authentic milkshakes--real deal, people.So I guess the only thing I REALLY liked about this place was their milkshakes and their garlic fries/onion rings/curly fries.:))

Reviews.Author: robert k.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I've been here more than once.  Everything is definitely 'meh'.  I think it's the location and the fact that it's just right there.  Going to a Sharks game?  It's right there.  Visiting SJSU with your parents?  Right there.  Tech museum?  Right there.Of course, once you get to know the area, you can find some better eats.  But since it's right there, it's always popular..To me, the burgers are middle of the road.  Meat is good, but the buns are dry.  The fries and rings are decent.  Of course the milkshakes are good (maybe that's why I keep coming back?) but other than that, meh.

Reviews.Author: Mark A.
Reviews.Content: Not as good as it used to be. I give an extra star for convenient locations but thats about it. McDonalds did much better than the dry cheeseburger i had here. Used to be good. Not any more.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan A.
Reviews.Content: The War Department, I mean the ball and chain, I mean my lovely GF and I rolled through here because we were waiting for some friends at nearby Firehouse, and were craving burgers.They were aw'ite, although my GF's cheeseburger was dripping mad grease like a meat sponge.Yeah, I said it.  Meat sponge.Nothing terrible, nothing spectacular, and will hit the spot if you are starving.But it will not fill the hole in your soul....

Reviews.Author: Parisa V.
Reviews.Content: we ordered Mushrooms swiss cheeseburger, garlic fries and regular hamburger. I absolutely loved the garlic fries and mushrooms swiss cheeseburger. they are open until 2 AM, the price is great and I will definitely make it a habit to revisit soon.

Reviews.Author: Ohr S.
Reviews.Content: "Meh" is right. Nothing special, pricey for why you get. I suppose if I were a huge milkshake lover I might bump this up a star. As it is, I'd recommend you just walk your ass right 'round the corner and grab a Cuban sandwich and fried plantains in hot sauce at Los Cubanos.

Reviews.Author: Phil L.
Reviews.Content: In a downtown full of high priced steakhouses and fusion restaurants, Peggy Sues offers classic american food at a decent price.  Very popular to eat at before any event at the HP Pavillion just because it's close to the HP Pavillion and it's pretty much as close to fast food as you can get in the downtown area.I always get the Silly Philly special and I'll admit I can easily get hooked to this meal.  Philly cheesesteak plus fries plus drink for 6-7 bucks?  Not too shabby.  Salads aren't worth it, but if there was one reason to come check this place out, it's to try their many different types of burgers.Prices have gone up a lil recently as well FYI.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey A.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have lived in San Jose for 5 years now. We've always been turned off by Peggy Sue's, but haven't ever been sure why. Well, this time we wanted to use a $6 off coupon we had-- so we bit the bullet and went against our better judgment. At Peggy Sue's this afternoon, my husband ordered a Turkey burger with onion rings and I ordered the Miss San Jose (chicken sandwich with grilled onions, mushrooms, and barbecue sauce) with curly fries. Normally, with sodas our meal would have cost $20, which is outrageous. It was only really worth it with our $6 off coupon, which brought it down to a reasonable $14. The food was a'ight. It was something I most certainly could have put together at home, so it was nothing I would go out of my way for. Next time I get another $6 off coupon, I'll just get a milkshake or something low key. I have to say that we both agreed that it tasted a bit better than Mojo burger, but not much.

Reviews.Author: Shannon L.
Reviews.Content: We went to Peggy Sue's for breakfast. I ordered the pancakes and my wife ordered the veggie omelet. Both came with a coffee and small orange juice. My father-in-law skipped breakfast and went straight to lunch. He ordered the fish & chips.My pancakes were good....I guess it's hard to mess up pancakes. My wife thought the veggie omelet was just okay. It did have lots of vegetables. My father-in-law liked the fish & chips.Overall, we thought the food was decent and the prices were pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Anna V.
Reviews.Content: I love diners with cool decor. This place has a good happy hour (I know, happy hour at a diner? haha). The thing that sucks is that they shut down their happy hour early on game and event days. Lame!Their food is okay - they come in good portions and they get to the point. Their chili cheese dog is good - they split the hot dog to make sure it cooks deliciously, the chili cheese topping comes in a generous amount, and they give you a nice side of diced tomatoes and onions for more toppings! Their burgers were alright... Some people may find them kinda blah. Their salads are overpriced and mediocre. This place is convenient to eat if you don't want to daddle around too long and don't want fast food. You pay for your order at the counter, seat yourself, and wait for your pickup number. It's in a great location - close to the shark tank, and next to some cool bars.

Reviews.Author: Michelle C.
Reviews.Content: Extremely mediocre American food and annoyingly kitschy decor. The staff is friendly, and my cobb salad had plenty of bacon, but for the price it's just not worth it.I could maybe drunkingly enjoy a burger here, but there's so many more options in the area I'd just as soon skip it.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: Basic diner food -- good for filling you up before hitting the bars or for sobering you up after hitting the bars.I've tried their soups, garden salad, chicken sandwich, turkey burger... I would never crave one of these items, but they weren't bad. Just nothing special. So many positives to this place though: awesome service, ample parking, walking distance from San Pedro bars/the Tank, reasonable pricing, open late -- hell, they even have a happy hour. The only downside to this dinner is the food!

Reviews.Author: Allister D.
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to try this place out! I knew it was a typical old fashioned diner but I had to have it! My gf and I tried it out since we were craving cheeseburgers and shakes! we both had cheeseburgers, fries, and a strawberry shake. It honestly wasn't anything too special. The taste was good. Service was wayy toooo slow. They must have had only 1 cook in the back. The price was decent I guess for a diner?! not too expensive. The portions were aite? The bar was a bit to dark to see though. This is where they served sodas and sauces for your burgers and fries. The lights needed to be a bit brighter to me because I could barely see my shit.The best part was our shake! SOO good and not stingy about their amount of it! They had the tall glass plus an extra cup full of shake! YUMMI would come back Peggy, sorry

Reviews.Author: Elaine N.
Reviews.Content: Right before Usher concert on Sunday, my group of girlfriends and I decided to eat here because we were really hungry.I ordered the Avocado Burger with added bacon because I love eating avocado with bacon. I thought the burger tasted plain and the texture was just okay. Nothing spectacular about it and the fries was alright. Overall, I would have to say this place is just A-OK!

Reviews.Author: Ryan L.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is an burger joint that has a 1950's flair: chrome, oldies, burgers, shakes and fries.  I stopped here to try something new.  There was only one family here on a Sunday night.  I imagine this place is much busier when the Sharks are playing.  The menu has a bunch of uninteresting burgers, sides, shakes and salads.  I chose the Hot Rod and sweet potato fries.  It was served "deconstructed" which means that I had to put it together.  A hamburger patty covered in pepper jack sat on a bun.  On the side was lettuce, tomato, two full strips of bacon and two little packages of mayo.  Ketchup and Mustard was on the table.  The burger was fine but neither huge nor memorable.  I was annoyed I had to construct the burger myself and found the mayo packets a tad tacky.  The sweet potato fries were perfectly fried and very tasty.  The guy who took my order wasn't very chipper.  He didn't want to be there.  In the end, neither did I.  I don't expect to return here.  I prefer Red Robin way over Peggy Sue's.

Reviews.Author: Chris V.
Reviews.Content: My friend told me to skip the fries, so I did. I had just a Teriyaki Burger. It was well-flavored, the bun had a good burger-y texture, and the meat patty was pretty solid. The lettuce and tomato came on the side, which might have been more helpful for avoiding a mess in the long run when I decided to eat it on the side and not to add it directly to the burger. It's no In-N-Out or a super fancy burger joint, but it's pretty good, albeit a bit pricey given the simplicity and size.Minus one star for not showing NHL games on a hockey night. I saw other places on this block that showing hockey or at least the highlights show on the NHL Network. They had soccer, college basketball, and college... volleyball? Bleh. Maybe minus another half star given the price concern.

Reviews.Author: Arman B.
Reviews.Content: I'm so sorry but I really felt like I was taken advantage of at this place. I typically wouldn't post a bad review if I felt like i just had a fluke bad experience or maybe if the cook wasn't on point or whatever the reason, but after checking the reviews (which I should have done before), I realized that this establishment has a reputation for bad reviews on the food. I have a feeling that they make their $ on the liquor so food isn't necessarily a priority, which is ok if it works for them. I ordered a chicken with avocado and received a dry chicken patty, cold bun, and 3 slivers of avocado that made me giggle. Overall it was overpriced cafeteria food. Hope they do something different because they seem like they could be a nice establishment.

Reviews.Author: Adrianna V.
Reviews.Content: I love San Pedro Square and would have never guessed this place served drinks until a friend told me about the famous shark tank! We stopped here before heading to Myth and shared since 32oz is too big for a girl who is under 5 feet (me). It was not as strong as I would have liked, probably because I'm spoiled with Patron and could barely taste the well tequila. Tasted very sweet so you could not taste the alcohol at all, sneaky! I did not try the food but really enjoyed how personable the staff was to our group, they conversed with us using our names and customer service like that stands out to me and will bring me back! This will forsure be a stop on my birthday night out.

Reviews.Author: Darrel S.
Reviews.Content: Do not step into this establishment until they change management! Food is horrible! Jack in the box has better curly fries than this place! I ordered the boneless chicken wings. And i would rather go to McDonald's for chicken mcnuggets! I complained to the cashier and i asked to get their famous avocado burger and got a thin piece of what looks like soy meat or some fake meat you would get at you local Taco Bell! I gave them a chance to fix it but they failed!

Reviews.Author: Tony M.
Reviews.Content: While visiting San Jose, CA. two weeks ago for the Barry Manilow Concert at the HP Pavilion, we decided to head towards downtown to grab something to eat after the show. There was not much open after 9:30 PM on Thursday but, I had been to this establishment before and when I got to North San Pedro, I saw it was open and since I had a burger craving, we walked in.The girl that was working the counter literally forced herself to respond to my hello and acted as though she was doing me a favor taking orders in between her conversations. I ordered us two double burgers with cheese and bacon along with two sides of fries and two sodas. She kept assuming I said onion rings and after the third time, she understood that I said fries. I kept my temper and patience in check but that was annoyance number one. After placing my order, I stood there and had to ask for my beverage cups for the self serve soda fountain.When the food was delivered, I had to call the server back as there was no bacon. The sever looked at the receipt as if he were puzzled. He took the food back to the kitchen and then came back and told us that there was an extra charge for the bacon of two dollars and change. At this point, I decided it was late and I wanted my food correctly. So, I got the change to give him and in fact, gave ten cents over and had never even gotten my change back. I never even got an apology from anyone there for their mistake.How tacky! It was the cashier's error and for customer service reasons, they should have complimented the bacon.As far as the food, I have had a much better food experience at Five Guys, Wendy's Sonic and Carl's Jr. The burger at Peggy Sue's was mediocre and had a frozen taste associated with blandness.The skimpy portion of fries were nothing to write home about either.The atmosphere is nice for a diner paying tribute to the past but they need to learn about customer service and how to train their employees to care about the customer. They also need to learn how to properly correct a scenario in a way that compliments the customer.The service for what was being charged was sub par and I shall not return. I don't know if this was owned by someone else about six or seven years ago but back then, it was good food and decent service.

Reviews.Author: A E.
Reviews.Content: Nothing noteworthy from the burger here.  The teriyaki burger was smothered in ultra-sweet teriyaki sauce (but then again, my bad for ordering a teriyaki anything in a burger joint / semi-fast-food-chain diner).  The fries are the frozen variety, so is the onion rings.  At least I didn't believe in their representation - "The best hamburger in the world" - and did not expect much of this place.  The interior looks like a tacky diner and a much better option is to utilize the outdoor seating, especially on a summer day, because San Pedro St is probably just about the only street in downtown San Jose where it is remotely nice to sit outside.Verdict: Peggy Sue's feels like a glorified McDonald's or Burger King, with a jukebox and outdoor seating area, and without kids meals with made-in-China toys and Ronald McDonald.

Reviews.Author: Heather K.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how something so greasy can be so tasteless, but I do know one thing, this place blows!  I'll stick to In-n-Out for burgers and shakes (and save plenty of $$ in the process).Someone mentioned the bathrooms.  Um, I guess some haven't noticed, they share the restrooms with O'Flaherty's pub!   In fact, head out the wrong direction in the hallway and you'll end up in the bar.I'll never order food at O'Flaherty's, because I'm more worried that they also might share a KITCHEN with Peggy Sue's....

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: I had a really good burgerThe meat was seasoned perfectly...the fries too.Comin back

Reviews.Author: eric k.
Reviews.Content: We'll stumble into here on the way to a sharks game or something downtown and no one can decide to go elsewhere.The food isn't bad.... but at the same time... nothing remarkable....  someone on the previous reviews said the burgers are worth a 20 mile drive or so?  I'm not so sure about that.They can get really busy in here sometimes, but when I do go... I'll usually order or share a shake, which are pretty good.  burgers?  they're ok....  prices are a tad high in that they are downtown SJ as well, which lends back to the convenience thing.  you'll usually get out of here for a about $12-15/person with a side and a drink.

Reviews.Author: Marion A.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I come here for dinner before Sharks games sometimes. He gets the Sharks special; I get the Pineapple Hot Pepper Jack (except for that one time I got chicken nuggets - yucky! never again!). The burgers are good and the prices are decent. Their milkshakes are excellent - we're big fans of the strawberry and the banana  -there are chunks of fresh fruit!It's not a place we go to unless we're downtown for a game. But since we're in the area, looking for dinner, and burgers are burgers (not the overpriced crap they sell at the Tank), Peggy Sue's will have to do.

Reviews.Author: Brian I.
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place if you're looking for Americana. Food was ok (ordered the avocado burger with fries). Service was friendly and very quick even on a Shark's home game night. Price was good for the meal and you can't beat $5 shark margaritas!My only complaint was that the fries were mostly undercooked.Would I go back again? Probably not given the many choices in the area.

Reviews.Author: Dave D.
Reviews.Content: A quick lunch for two, especially when taking advantage of happy hour, shouldn't have to cost $17 - especially when all the food is mediocre.If you fix yourself a sandwich or a burger, because you are hungry it doesn't matter if the quality of the food is just okay.  If you go out to eat and all you get is "just ok" then you've wasted your time and money.The chicken sandwich I ordered was too salty.  The fries lacked enough salt and really were just "Meh."  The Malt was okay, but nothing to write home about.I wish I had checked Yelp beforehand.

Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: After a fantastic dinner at San Pedro Square Bistro & Wine Bar, I just had to buy a chocolate malt for me and my best girl. She is so keen! One malt, two straws please!They serve up a mean malt here. Thick, creamy, rich. I will say that the service here is difficult to asess since you pretty much serve yourself. The cashier who took my order was very nice though. This place does lose stars since it took 20 minutes to get our malt. Pity.Great stuff to be had, as long as you aren't in a hurry and not expecting exceptional 50's service. If you want that, I know a great place in Greendale, WI...

Reviews.Author: Gabrielle M.
Reviews.Content: I was hungry and I have been to Peggy Sue's a long time ago, like what I was 10. It was good back then.I ordered chicken nuggets and fries and clam chowder. I didn't think it would be top of the line food but I expected better.  The soup was watery and the chicken nuggets tasted like the ones you make at home in the microwave. The only good part of my meal was the fries. I definitely won't eat here again....
