Reviews.Author: Trudy H.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's has that cool 50s feel burger bar thing going on. It really feels like a diner. I ordered the hot wings. They are serious. My sinuses were cleared and my lips began to peel. i really appreciate that in hot wings. I have had hot wings at many places in several states and these were some of the best. Love their fries, plan or garlic ones.My friends that were with me had burgers and enjoyed them as well. The service was good. Only thing is that the drinks were a little flat. The service was good. I will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Author: Monica W.
Reviews.Content: My friend was craving a burger right before the ISA Bay Area show and as you have it, Peggy Sue's was right across the street from where we first found some street parking.  Peggy Sue's can be described as a mix between sports bar and a diner, it's cute, spacious and clean. You place your order at the counter, and despite having a pick up order sign at the counter they brought our food to our table. You fill your own soda, get your own condiments and silverware, and grab your own peperoncini. For a Saturday at 3 PM the place was fairly dead inside for a while.I went with a Peggy Sue burger for $4.50 which is just a regular hamburger and added fries and a drink for an additional $2.55. Burger comes with lettuce, tomato and a package of mayo. I was disappointed that it didn't come with any onions but I added ketchup, mustard, peperoncini, and two types of bbq sauce to my burger to dress it up. In the end, I'd say it was an unremarkable burger which needs extra flavor (and onions). The price for what you get isn't bad, the fries tasted fine but weren't that memorable. Peggy Sue wouldn't be my go-to place for a gourmet monster burger, but if I lived closer it might be my go-to place for a cheap and quick lunch.

Reviews.Author: Patricia V.
Reviews.Content: I dipped in here after finishing today's San Jose Rock n Roll 1/2 marathon but while checking out the menu I decided that my stomach wasn't really up for burger and fries. Seems like a cool little place and a flash back to the show 'Happy Days'.Burgers, fries, milkshakesJuke boxCheckered floorLittle round tables with formica tops.Happy people woofin down burgers.

Reviews.Author: Glenn S.
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed! Thought this was going to be an old fashion burger, totally opposite. Patty was thin and tasteless and small. Fries were old. Don't think I'll be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Julianna M.
Reviews.Content: Your typical diner food - burgers, fries, shakes. It's tasty and the drinks are good. I've been here a couple of times and it's exactly what you expect. I've been here when it's busy and quieter, but I felt that service was good and friendly. It's a good staple to have in the middle of San Pedro Square.

Reviews.Author: Erika M.
Reviews.Content: if only I could rate without having to give any stars, I would.went to Peggy Sue's for take out dinner for my husband. Wanted to surprise him with a good burger as he likes. But to my surprise, this place is dull from ambiance to the taste of the food. If you can call that food. It was practically a piece of rubber for meat and the lettuce as if had been sitting in the fridge for ever! There's no way I'm going back there even to ask for my money back.The employees sure make you feel welcome here:( old taste for sure.

Reviews.Author: Jason T.
Reviews.Content: Was there for a Sharks game this past weekend.  Ran short on time so we stopped by Peggy Sues for some quick burgers.  Ordered the Cheeseburger and Philly Cheesteak.  Both were sub par.  Tasted like something you can order at Denny's!Being that there was a Sharks game, 99% of the crowd were Sharks fans.  I assume they'd rather eat here than eat garbage-like concession food at the arena.  With that said, there was absolutely no seating.  Not much I can say that everyone hasn't already pointed out.  Avoid if possible!

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: Get the breakfast burrito with ham and bacon!!Park on the street if you can find one or just park in the garage right across the street, of course payment is required.Free parking afer 6pm, but then you'll miss out on breakfast time. Manage your time wisely-

Reviews.Author: Audrey C.
Reviews.Content: Why is this place a big deal? It's not flavored too much, the burgers themselves are just okay. I still prefer Foster Freeze down a few blocks from here. Those burgers are the real deal IMO. Its not even like a real diner. You have to stand in line to order. The inside is a looker though, always fun to brows the walls.

Reviews.Author: Kit K.
Reviews.Content: OK! I work in downtown San Jose and I'm going to have lots of reviews of restaurants around the area.  Honestly, this place is one of the last places I would want to go eat lunch at.  Every time my co-workers ask me to go to this place. I always reject their offer. The burger is dry and no flavor.  The portion isn't great and the fries are ok.  There is nothing special about this place at all.  It is way over-price for you get here. The only good thing about this place is their shakes.  That is the only reason why I'm giving it a 2 stars.  Other than that, I dislike going there.

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: I was hoping, with all these great reviews for milkshakes, that they would have real cream and not partially hydrogenated, fake crap on top.  I was pretty turned off and avoided the stuff.The fish and chips (which we had the privilege of paying $2-3 extra for at the bar next door) were decent.  I really enjoyed someone else's garlic fries.

Reviews.Author: Gal B.
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the food. Granted, I ordered a veggie burger which can be bland. However, the avocado burger barely had any avocado on it. I could barely taste it. The bun felt store bought. There was a tasteless piece of tomato, and lettuce and no other condiments (a pickle, red onion? And the fries were not good. Its hard to screw that up! I do have to say the milkshake and service was good. But we both wished we went to in n out instead, and won't be back.

Reviews.Author: Emily P.
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say is that I LOVE PEGGY SUE'S!!! If you read My Reviews on the other Peggy Sue's location on Park you can see how much I love Peggy Sue's! BUT....this Peggy Sue's is totally different. Both Peggy Sue's locations are different owners and they have the same menu but make their food totally different!!! As you see the reviews on this location aren't great, PLEASE try other location! That place is yummy!

Reviews.Author: Monica B.
Reviews.Content: This place is sort of a ritual before seeing shows at AMTSJ.  Since we come from the North Bay to see the shows after work, we rarely have time for a long sit-down meal, therefore Peggy Sue's delicious fried foods have been what hits the spot. Items on our favorite list include their Fish and Chips and Chicken Tenders (always fresh) curly fries, onion rings, garlic fries, and gardenburgers. Food has always been terrific and therefore not the cause of the low rating.Last night, we ordered the following:Kids Meal Grilled Cheese Sandwich with Curly FriesChicken StripsAnd it took FORTY MINUTES TO GET OUR ORDER. After the 15 minutes of waiting in line! Meaning, from the time we walked in the door to the time we got our food was an hour. For glorified fast food. Since we were forced to ask for to-go boxes when we picked up our food because at that point we had 10 minutes before the show and still had to pick up our tickets, it is doubtful that we will EVER come here again before the shows. Come here only if you have all the time in the world, not if you're going to a show at AMTSJ.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: Ordinary and decent diner fare with reasonable price without the typical diner services that you can expect from the North East.I came here a few times during lunch because its very close to where I work.  Almost always, I order the lunch combo (burger of your choice, curly fries, and a drink) for $7.99 plus tax.  Since its self served here, I have not paid tips, and almost always have it to go and eat at the couple out door seatings.Only once did the casher asked me how I want the meat cooked.  But then again, who cares in a diner, because how often do doness come out the way you want for a burger this in-expensive.I do like their bacon, as its thick and crispy.  But, I am very certain that the bacon have been prepared long before I arrived.Although I do frequent this place, it did not make it as a "destination" for me.  It is just a fairly inexpensive and fairly quick place to fill my stomac during working hours.Parking can be a drag, but if you work close by, this place could be for you.

Reviews.Author: Jeff G.
Reviews.Content: Excellent condiment bar, good selection of burgers and solid fries. Haven't had a bad dining experience at either location in about a dozen trips. Plus they recently started serving a buck-fifty pint. So, really, why the long faces yelp?

Reviews.Author: Joel E.
Reviews.Content: Closed on Black Friday. Nothing on their website. Nothing on their front door, other than a standard "Closed" sign, next to the posted hours, which indicated that they were open from 9 a.m. till midnight. It looked perfectly normal for 7 a.m., except it was 11:45 a.m.All the neighboring restaurants were open. Was going to use a Groupon. Now will hope Groupon will issue a refund.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie S.
Reviews.Content: FOOD:I got their Hollywood (avocado) burger and a banana milkshake. OK burger... BEST milkshake I've ever had! They use fresh bananas and leave tiny chunks unblended, which is nice cause it makes the shake taste really fresh. SERVICE:We went here last Saturday around lunch and the place was really empty. We were literally the only two people in the restaurant, and keep in mind this is during lunch time. There was no greeter to hand out menus or seat us, so we just went to the front to order. Waitress was friendly when she brought out the food and the food came fast though.

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is your typical All-American diner.  If you set your expectations too high or else you might be disappointed, but if you're looking for a quick meal you might be fine with what you get from this place.

Reviews.Author: Samson W.
Reviews.Content: I finally had an opportunity to eat at the original location last Saturday as my friend suggested meeting at this place.  It was definitely daunting for me as there were so many good choices on the menu.  I finally decided on a pineapple bacon burger, which was pretty good.  Will not say that it is the best.  But then, it's not the worse either. I know from the past that they used to have a larger menu with both unusual names and funny names for their burgers and sandwiches.  They have since taken that out.I didn't try their shakes as I heard good things about it.  I might try it the next time that I go there.

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: Food is okay....not great, not nearly as bad as some have said.  I will agree burgers lack a certain something, but fries and shakes are good.  I like the condiment bar.   Gets fairly busy around lunch time.  Not a bad place to go if you work in the area and are tired of Togo's, Subway, etc, but don't want to spend a lot either.  Actually, the thing I like best on the menu is the Chili Cheese Fries.  You get that with a drink and your total is $6.66.  Eerie.

Reviews.Author: RaeAnne H.
Reviews.Content: It's pretty upsetting when I read over the less than 3 start reviews. I think people are missing the magic of this restaraunt.  It is located in an almost perfect area that is family friendly and also caters to the needs of the party animals and bar-hoppers of san jose.  The prices are perfect for the food you get and recently the owners have made some major changes, most specifically the burger.  the burgers are now larger, seasoned and marinated for your taste buds pleasure.They offer a happy hour menu which is the longest happy hour I've ever seen! 3-7! thats four hours to get cheap food and drinks.Not to mention the full bar and the awesome bar tender they have on duty, who comes up with the most creative and well priced drinks you couldthink of.Peggy sues is the perfect late night spot to hang out at and to sober up. It has the best food on the block and i would chose it over disgusting la victoria's any day.it's really stupid when people complain about the service since it is obviously a self serve diner.  The cashiers are not paid to bring you their food and yet they always do unless its a busy sharks night.this place rocks and is one of the last honest and worthy places to eat in downtown san jose.

Reviews.Author: Tedd F.
Reviews.Content: Horrible horrible horrible!We ordered 2 burger sans bun and a large fries to share.   The burgers came out burnt and just that... a burger.  No lettuce no toppings (we were not even asked is we wanted any).  Just a big plate and a burnt small slab of meat.  The fries were old and cold.  We have to ask twice for silverware.  A total waste of $20.... yes $20!!!!!!!!!  For shit food.  AVOID even if you are desperate for food and they are the only place open.

Reviews.Author: Brad F.
Reviews.Content: This place serves what i would call a "lazy burger."  A lazy burger that gives up and collects welfare from the state rather than picking itself up by the bootstraps and making something worthwhile of itself.  it didn't taste terrible per se, but it had that vague "elementary school cafeteria" texture to it.  it's like that scene with Michael Douglas in Falling Down where he goes into "Whammy Burger" and says "now, look at this sorry, miserable, squashed thing"  when comparing to what he received vs. what's advertised.   Yea, this burger was kind of like that.The tomato and lettuce that weren't all that fresh, and the condiments bar could also be described as "lacking in motivation and initiative" as well.  I threw half the salad away.... it was kind of 'clammy'The ambiance is neat if you're into the nostalgic thing:  big screen tv's, movie posters from America's better days gone by, etc.   But that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Seth H.
Reviews.Content: You can't fault Peggy Sue's for being what they claim to be.  They are a cheap eats restaurant.  Cheap burgers, cheap fries and super cheap drinks (especially on Sharks game nights with 32oz $7 beers and monster $10 margaritas).Is the food high quality?  Certainly not but then why are you here anyway?  I loved that I could put what I wanted on my burger and it was ready almost before I sat down.  You also can't beat a mostly empty restaurant even on game day.

Reviews.Author: Sarah P.
Reviews.Content: this place is not a good breakfast place.the pancakes were so thick it was unbelievable, the chicken fried steak is inedible and the burgers are ok.I would just never go back to this place

Reviews.Author: Xiomara R.
Reviews.Content: So I haven't been here since for ever! The menu changed I'm not sure for the best. I was really craving this steak sandwich they used to have and when I went in they didn't have it. =[ But! they did have a delish Peanut BUTTER and BANANA Milk SHAKE which i gobbled down......

Reviews.Author: Tony C.
Reviews.Content: I like going to this place before Sharks games.  The burgers here are good but a bit on the expensive side for burgers.  The fries I usually skip because there is nothing great about them. I mainly come here for milkshakes.  They give you a large portion for your milkshake, a large glass and a bit under half of the large metal mixer they mixed it in.  It is totally filling in and of itself.  If you have a small appetitie just skip the burger and go for the milkshake.  Skip the chicken nuggets, they look like the ones you buy from the grocery store and heat up in the microwave.  They have 3 LCD tvs on the wall and I like all the sports and history memorabilia on the walls.  Its a great place to lounge around before or after games.Come here for the milkshakes or to hang out with fellow Shark fans.  If you want good cheap burgers, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Burger meat was flat, tough, and tasted of salt. Only received 4 small onion rings. Chocolate shake was just vanilla sixty serve with chocolate syrup. Would rather have gone to Wendys.

Reviews.Author: Frank c.
Reviews.Content: double cheeseburger awesome going back again today, in a word : delish!!the employees are casual and helpful. most importantly they have JAMO!!

Reviews.Author: Robert P.
Reviews.Content: Burger was delicious!

Reviews.Author: Manish P.
Reviews.Content: Food is overpriced, portions are small and they get your orders wrong!There are other options VERY close to this place ... no need to go this place.One of the Yelp survey questions is "This place is Good For"? I would like to say "Nothing"!

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: I find out about this restaurant online. According to MSN, this place is the BEST Burger Joint in Silicon Valley, so I gave it a shot. The burgers are average, the patties where small and.... Yea, it was JUST average. Honestly, I would rather go to an In-and-Out for better burgers, but at least I got to experience a 50s diner in the 21st century! WOW

Reviews.Author: Swiftly T.
Reviews.Content: I got a veggie burger and it was dry as hell with nothing but a piece of lettuce and a tomato on a bun they probably bought at safeway last week.I remember this place being better but haven't been in a long time.  I won't be going back

Reviews.Author: Supreet S.
Reviews.Content: A few of us came upon this place in the evening.  We were not impressed with this place to say the least.  I did not have any expectations.  The burgers and fries were tasteless (the quality of their patty's were as terrible as it gets).  We ordered shakes with our meal and they happen to bring out an extra one and charge us for it! We tried to argue for a refund on that shake but no such luck.  It is basically an old fashioned American diner with an Indian owner, which never goes over well.  On top of the poor service we found the food to be overpriced.  if you love greasy, over priced, no flavor burgers and sandwiches than this place, my friend, is the place for you! I will not be paying a second visit to this establishment.

Reviews.Author: nelle a.
Reviews.Content: whoa peggy sue!...you sure do serves grody breakfast plates....i was totally fizzled.having a small glass of orange juice and a cup of coffee included with my vegetarian omelette won't make my plate appetizing...you know why?...your hash brown was disgusting! you're not suppose to boil the potatoes and put big chunks of green peppers with it!!!..what was that all about?...maybe you're trying to make a "exclusive" hash brown?..well, you better not name it hash brown...it's more like a potato salad sans the mayo.also, my omelette was distasteful!...why did you use monterey jack cheesse instead of the usual american cheddar cheese that a typical diner usesthe hamburger with bacon & swiss cheese was below average. the curly fries that went with it had a taste of "old oil."what a disaster meal we had!...and there you are,  you got married with your high school sweetheart charlie....i wonder what he will do if he found out you don't know how to cook.

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Peggy Sue's in downtown!!I don't understand why they're getting low reviews!!  What's with the hate?? The ambience is great, the food is excellent, the $2 beer on tap is freakin' awesome!! The owners are cool and friendly. I will keep coming here as long as I live in San Jose! :D

Reviews.Author: Narelle P.
Reviews.Content: my friend works there. always nice to see him putting it down for pegy sue's. I've been going there since i was a kid! love the location... this peggy sues is #1 in my book. the other one is ok....Cant wait to take my kids there... oh wait!... yes i can XD

Reviews.Author: jenn w.
Reviews.Content: I really don't want to write about how this is an awesome place for pre-drinking before Sharks games because there just aren't enough tables.  Make sure you go early so you can grab a table, or while you are ordering, have your friends keep their eyes out for people leaving.  The beers are super cheap since you can get a 32oz for $7.  Or, you can get the crazy Shark tank cocktail that comes in a giant goblet for $10.  Because of the cheap drinks, it really is no surprise that a lot of people come here before events.  The food is not the greatest but it is decent and adequate.

Reviews.Author: Sdmomma R.
Reviews.Content: If you love greasy ass, over priced, no flavor burgers and chicken sandwiches than this place my friend is the place for you! Yuck! Can't believe I spent my money on this nasty ass food. Will not be coming here  ever again!

Reviews.Author: Tiff T.
Reviews.Content: The hamburgers and fries served at Peggy Sue's are better than most places because it's not too greasy.  I usually order from the children's menu because I can't finish the regular sizes.  I like the "Porky Pig" and hot dogs.  The wait for the food can be long, but you can people watch on the patio or look at all the sports and other weird memorabilia on the walls while you're waiting.

Reviews.Author: Laurie B.
Reviews.Content: New Management = Cheap, Corner-cutting quality!  I've been dining here off and on since the late 90's and it used to be a great place. Just came in with a coupon that was still valid, but the miserly manager said they changed management recently and won't honor them. Lame. Why not instill customer loyalty in a rough economy and continue to honor the coupons? I would have gotten over the coupon issue if the food were still good.  No luck there.  My burger was over pressed, dry, and mealy.  I could have gone to McDonald's and the burger would have been a little better for a lot less.  The fries were also anemic - thin, barely any potato to them.So sad, this place used to have juicy burgers, thick fries, and better service.Last time we're coming here before they start charging for napkins!

Reviews.Author: Jason G.
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Peggy sues for over 15 years, mainly on SJ Sharks game night.  $32.58 for 2 "Sharks specials" (burger and fries with soda). They are officially over priced and won't see my dad and I again.

Reviews.Author: Karen T.
Reviews.Content: in 'n out will still be number 1 in my heart when it comes to cheap and easy [that's what she said!!! kidding.  no, not really.] burgers, but this place is okay too, at least whenever i'm in downtown sj.  it's kitschy like mel's diner in sf and kind of like johnny rocketts, but not as expensive and a little less clean.  so... basically it's just okay.during my most recent visit i had the jack pepper hot cheeseburger, or something like that.  basically it supposedly had peppers and pepperjack cheese with bacon.  om nom nom.  bacon.  i friggin' love bacon.  the thick cut, the grease, oh, how my thighs would respond if i decided to go with a bacon filled diet!  ANYHOW, the burger itself was decent, nothing too special.  couldn't really taste the jackpepper or the slight kick that peppers usually have, but maybe i'm just used to spicier things.their garlic fries were good, but for the three or four dollars that they charged for it, i felt like they could have given us some more [maybe i am just greedy].if you're looking for an inexpensive place to go have lunch at- this could definitely be the spot.  just don't set the bar too high.

Reviews.Author: Devon H.
Reviews.Content: The faux 50's sock-hop theme is tasteless and uninispired -- as is their food.

Reviews.Author: grey h.
Reviews.Content: Sooo its been a Long time since high school,  the time when everyone I knew who had come here had raved about it.  Unfortunately I never had the opportunity to stop by until now,  and I didn't bother reading the reviews because I qanted to try it based on here-say and not be biased.... I now wish I ate It back then so I can at least say what it was better than.  Honestly dissapointed in price for flavor point-WaYY OVERPRICED FOR LOW QUALITY-the patty was sooo blehhhhh and sure its customizable,  but u have to have a good base for it to get bettwr with toppings right? I was starving when I got here and bases on the fact that It couldn't appeal to my taste buds is just sad... The garlic fries only have garlic powder.... Not real garlic booooo.. The only tasty thing was shake and it was overpriced too...

Reviews.Author: Flo P.
Reviews.Content: Food is not good. Beer is not cheap. Service is bad

Reviews.Author: Yvonne C.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is one of my favorite breakfast spots. For $3.25, you get a HUGE breakfast burrito filled with bacon, fluffy eggs, potatoes, and cheddar cheese that is big enough to feed 2 people. Another good deal is the $5.95 breakfast menu which features dishes like omelette's, pancakes, french toast, chorizo, and your typical bacon or sausage and eggs. What's nice is that coffee, juice, hash browns, and toast are all included with your meal, so it's an excellent value. Peggy Sue's makes a wonderful chocolate shake and feature a variety of tasty burgers. There is something for every body on their menu.

Reviews.Author: Tim W.
Reviews.Content: The staff has always been friendly to me and the food has always been delicious. The music is perfect for the vibe they are going for and it feels like a 50s diner (thought I can't say that I was alive in the 1950s). They do have slightly high priced burgers, but the ambiance is worth it. I really want to try their milkshakes next time I go!

Reviews.Author: Rich M.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hamburger in my life. Dry, tasteless, could not  even finish it. Chocolate shake was excellent as were the curly fries, so gave them the second star. Place was completely empty. I snuck out before I could be asked how my meal was...but no worries, no one every checked on me.

Reviews.Author: Lisa S.
Reviews.Content: The burger tasted burnt and flavorless. I would much rather eat at In N Out Burger and pay half the price. The fries tasted as if they were cooked in fish oil. This place used to be okay but has really went downhill lately.

Reviews.Author: Jonathon J.
Reviews.Content: The burgers here are incredible.  I live in Foster City and the drive to Peggy Sue's is worth it.  The fries are fresh and the milkshakes are out of this world.  Still, both only come in second to the burgers.

Reviews.Author: C M.
Reviews.Content: Raised their prices again. Seriously? This place is a bankruptcy just waiting to happen.  What did I get for a breakfast burrito that now costs $1.02 more?  Crap that was inedible. I took a few bites and the eggs were so overcooked I just could not eat that garbage. What kind of moron can't scramble eggs?

Reviews.Author: Amber M.
Reviews.Content: Was in the mood for a burger so thought we would give this a try.  Burgers are bit but a little dry.  Maybe that they are precooked and warmed up or just over cooked. Service is friendly.  Old time Dinner feel.

Reviews.Author: Kim T.
Reviews.Content: Great Before a San Jose Sharks Game for a Sharks Tank. You'll be happy you did it! Ive also had the San Jose Chicken sandwich i believe it was called. It was really good. I mainly go for the Tanks!!

Reviews.Author: Grant S.
Reviews.Content: Not bad good, but over priced for frozen patties.... Customer service was garbage,....

Reviews.Author: Vicky T.
Reviews.Content: The combinations have great names, and they have some classic burger combos, as well as some combos to rep the sharks (hat trick combos). The place is your usual 1950s diner-esque type place. The portions are not anything fabulous, and the burgers do not stand out in any sort of way. Their fries are yummy (krinkle cuts) and their onion rings are pretty cheap (1.50 or something like that for a small-- which is enough for one person).  Reasonably clean, reasonable service, and lots of San Jose's finest (the sign of a decent diner: swarming with po-po). I might go here after going to the San Pedro theatre-- but not going out of my way to come here every time I am in San Jose.

Reviews.Author: Cheri M.
Reviews.Content: I love diners. I love bugers, fries and shakes so this place is right up my alley. Stopped here today with the BF after meeting a client. It was slow (around 4pm on a Thurs). The 50s decor is cute and I really liked the old newspapers. It's a lot of self service. They have a huge menu and you go up to the register and order your food & pay. I got a burger w/ jack cheese and avocado, curly fries and a strawberry shake. The BF got the peggy sue cheeseburger w/ curly fries. You get your own sodas and condiments at the little condiment bar (pickles, peppers, mayo, ranch..) ketchup and mustard is on the table. The guy who took our order was extremely nice and when the food was done he actually brought it out to our table. The milkshake was BIG and pretty tasty I prob won't do the strawberry again cuz it's got the strawberry chunks in it and they freak me out. I don't get strawberry yogurt because the chunks freak me out.. others may enjoy this but I dont. It was really good though despite the chunks. The burger was a little small but it was GOOD. The burgers are a little pricey so they should probably give you a little more bang for your buck. The curly fries were bomb. They have happy hour here too and the menu looked pretty good but we didn't get anything. Maybe next time.If in the area we would come back. Also parking was very convenient right next to the place and across the street.

Reviews.Author: Crystal V.
Reviews.Content: Great food and shakes. I don't eat burgers so I can't describe them to you, but the hot dogs are good, shakes are AMAZING, fries are mediocre, and the decor and vibe are what you "half" come for here. Great for families? Kid dates, mom/dad date with kid(s), great for dates, especially if they're before or after a Sharks game!!! There is a soda fountain so free refills. Since this is a downtown city, free refills are lucky to come by. (won't see that in the city!!) so great place to come to. While you wait for your food check out the decor and teach your kid or date somethin'!!!

Reviews.Author: Frank D.
Reviews.Content: The worst burger I have ever had, thiner then BK, dry and hard, the buns ware dry and tasted like they ware at least from yesterday, you would expect from a place that specializes in burgers to be better then the fast food chains,The one star is for the seats and the restrooms, at least you can seat down or use the restrooms...

Reviews.Author: mel w.
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed!!!  I've been going to Peggy Sue's for a long time and I will never go back.  I don't know if they're under new management or tight on cash...  But the burger was worse than a week old McDonald's burger!!!  Definitely not worth $6..  A plate of 17 fries for $4. 79!! I have always ordered the little bopper (now the little cheeseburger) and I ordered it today and the guy was like Ok cool...  Then when the food came out there were no fries..  I asked the girl where the fries were and she went to ask someone...  Then she came back and said that meal is only for 12 and under..  WTF?!?!  I've been ordering that meal forever!  The malt was not very malty and not mixed well at all.  Overall I will never recommend or come back here.  This used to be my go to place before sharks games..  RIP Peggy Sue's.

Reviews.Author: Adrienne H.
Reviews.Content: It was 'OK'. I mean, personally, Sliders Burgers on Leigh and San Carlos is WAY better, but if you are downtown and you are craving a burger, than this is the place for you. I didn't eat any fries, but I did LOVE their malt shakes.

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: My kids and I always go to Peggy Sue's after we see a show at the Center for the Performing Arts. The food is decent but not spectacular. They have really good milkshakes and floats. Lately , we've been sticking to the fries and shakes just because we know that they can't possible mess those up. Definitely stay away from their restrooms because they are disgusting!!

Reviews.Author: Angela H.
Reviews.Content: I basically needed to eat something. My well-done burger was cooked medium, but I didn't have the foresight to care. The shakes looked amazing. Fries were good -- curley fries, at least. Open past one.

Reviews.Author: Bryan L.
Reviews.Content: Eh, my Cousin and I went here before a Sharks game the other night.  Seating sucks on game days.  Food is overpriced and no better than school cafeteria quality in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Leilani N.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, the fries aren't that great and the buffalo wings are way too salty. But, considering the options downtown, I'd rather eat here than most places. Things are decently priced, they offer alcohol, they have TVs to put up any games that are going on, and they have friendly service. It's a pretty standard, but consistent place.

Reviews.Author: Joanne S.
Reviews.Content: I used to frequent Peggy Sue's back in my college days.  I thought their food was the ish..but I was a poor college student and my food standards were a lot lower back then (i.e. Olive Garden was considered "fancy dining").I've been back a few times this year and, surprisingly, I still find their food pretty good.I'm not a beef eater, so I'm glad that they have some non-beef options.  Their regular turkey burger is just ok, but I ordered the turkey patty on a patty melt and it was really good.  It had just the right amount of grilled onions, melted Swiss cheese and mustard and the rye bread was grilled.  The turkey patty was juicy too!  One thing that I didn't like was that the cashier didn't inform us that substituting the turkey patty would be an additional $1.50.  Also, they charge extra if you want your onions grilled on a normally non-grilled onion burger.  I guess times are hard all around...so whatever.This is a good place for a quick bite if you're on your way to a Sharks game or concert at HP Pavilion.  It's conveniently located across the street from a big parking garage that's walking distance to the Pavilion.

Reviews.Author: C B.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast's are good, burgers are tasteless.

Reviews.Author: Andrea B.
Reviews.Content: I give it a 2 star because the cashier was nice. I bought a large fry for$4.99 it was so small like a Mac Donald's kid fries. I asked the server if this was a large fry.  Just  in case they gave me the wrong order , he said yes this is a large fry. The hamburger tasted like cheap frozen meet it was not juicy at all. I think the owner is trying to cut cost. For two hamburger one soda and a banana split $30.00. It was not worth it and I will not be back.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra R.
Reviews.Content: I came across this place because it across the street and around the corner from where i work (the tech museum!). i had heard good things about it from my coworkers but have to admit i was a little disapointed. I ordered a cheesburger, fries and a drink. Not too difficult right? well, they took forever to make it. the portions were rather small for the price and it was a very dead atmosphere. the only reason I eat there sometimes is because its so close to the tech. besides that, i wouldn't eat there.

Reviews.Author: Scott A.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is a good place to go before heading to the HP Pavilion to see the Sharks play. It can be hard to get a table sometimes, and you'll have to sit at a dirty one and flag the busser down to have them clean it. The burgers are pretty standard. They used to have names for each burger, but now I think they've gotten rid of that. The banana milkshakes are good too!

Reviews.Author: Katelyn A.
Reviews.Content: I think most of the food here is pretty standard.  I don't know why, out of all the places to eat downtown, someone would eat here.  The breakfast is decent, but the burgers and other entree items are merely a way to make yourself not hungry.  I will admit that the shakes here are pretty good.

Reviews.Author: Darren M.
Reviews.Content: Ew this place is disgusting! It's basically just Johnny Rocket's with a different name and I really cannot stand it. I've had to go here a couple of times with friends and every time I cringe at the thought of their food as I walk into their dirty restaurant. Not to mention the bathrooms are always messy and the employees are pretty careless. AVOID!

Reviews.Author: Jackie J.
Reviews.Content: I don't go to Peggy Sue's often but I think the food is pretty decent. I usually get the burgers and fries. There's parking across the street at the garage and it's walking distance to multiple places (clubs & HP).

Reviews.Author: H. L. L.
Reviews.Content: I personally like Peggy Sues but their prices just don't justify me coming here more than once a quarter, not because they're steep but not how much I would want to pay on the daily for burgers or fries.  Was really disappointed because I had planned on going to Scott's Seafood and didn't realize they didn't open lunch time on weekends...dumb. Oh well.Ordered: 1) Great Balls of Fire $5.95 - Angus burger with one big grilled pepper, cheese and jalapeno sauce.  This was good but it wasn't spicy the way I would expect it to be spicy considering how it's called "Great Balls of Fire" but it was good.  I had to add some jalapenos as well as tabasco sauce but whatever.  2) Chicken Wings (Spicy wings on a bed of fries) $5.95 -  The wings had a LOT of sauce and DEFINITELY had a good kick to it though I do remember getting a lot more wings when I went a few months back. We also replaced reg fries with garlic fries for an extra $1 or something? Still didn't taste much like "garlic" fries.3) Curly Fries $3.25 - I liked it.  It was perfectly crispy and rather large in size but they're still curly fries :)We went away with a lot of sauce to go with it and I enjoyed every bit of it despite the price I paid.  The service was fast and prompt.AND they validate parking! Definitely a plus!I will come back.

Reviews.Author: Lynda T.
Reviews.Content: ... came here with my honey.. It was good, but fries were soggy and cold.

Reviews.Author: J R.
Reviews.Content: Breakfast burritos!!!! I worked down the street and got breakfast burritos from here all the time! They were really good priced and filled me up! Actually I never even finish the burrito which means LUNCH TIME!!!!

Reviews.Author: Joshua S.
Reviews.Content: Had good service last time I came here a couple years ago. This time, I came here with some friends late at night and despite just having a few people in the restaurant we had to wait a full hour for our order. The worst part is that most of the food was terrible and one order was wrong, requiring an additional 15min wait. My meal was so bad, I could only take a few bites and ended up leaving hungry. With so many solid options in San Pedro Square, I can't see why I would home here again.

Reviews.Author: Summer V.
Reviews.Content: Not letting me order a grilled cheese? Shame on you. If there is a portion on your menu that's for kids, Please write that on the menu. I can't read your owners mind. And refusing to make me a grilled cheese is rediculous. I will not waste my time again.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly C.
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is 3 to 4 stars and the other food is about a 2. The menu is fun with so many cute names for the dishes. It is a diner don't expect too much and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Liquidman ..
Reviews.Content: Just not that great.

Reviews.Author: dave m.
Reviews.Content: We went to Peggy Sues last night before the Eagles concert because they were not as crowded as some of the other restauraunts in the area. That was a huge mistake. I don't normally bash anyone but the service here was HORRIBLE! The main problem they had was the ONE guy they had to pour drinks from the bar was all over the restauraunt. So we ordered our food and drinks and the guy who was working the bar decided to start taking orders as well from the other cash register. He completely ignored me and about 5 other customers who were all standing there just WAITING to get our drinks? HELLO... I was about ready to go behind the bar and pour my beer myself. Then this idiot decides while he is taking new orders from other customers coming in that he will pour there drinks as he is taking there orders, but meanwhile we are all still standing around waiting for our drinks they never gave us. After 20 mins. of this BS I decided to get BACK in line to order food. When I finally got up to this guy he asked what I want? and I told him me and all these other customers would like our drinks. He told me to hold on while he was entering some tickets into the register which took him another 5 mins. just to do that. Then to top off our entire experiance evidently the girl who took our order accidently deleted it so our food never came. I had to get back in line a third time just to get that straightened out. We spent probably an hour there for this whole ordeal? The only one positive thing I can say is they gave me another beer on the house since they royally screwed up our entier order. As far as the food goes at this place it was just sub-par. In n Out makes a WAY better burger and fries. There are a lot of better restauraunts in the area, don't waste your TIME and money at this dive. If I had to rate the service I would give it a -10, unfortunately Yelp does not let you give a negative review, but they should for places like this. I can understand if maybe someone is off or made a mistake but just the complete lack of service here would make me never step foot in this place again. So Yelpers, Youve been Warned!

Reviews.Author: Ernest C.
Reviews.Content: This place has character and good food to boot. I love that it added some booz to the menu so I can get the drink I want before a sharks game...

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline N.
Reviews.Content: Went here before the sharks game. Didn't eat too much. Got the hotdog-- not bad. I was expecting it to be cheap and blehh, but it was decent. And the only other thing we got was the Shark Tank drink. That was of course delicious. :]

Reviews.Author: Ashley P.
Reviews.Content: I got a chicken sandwich and it was tasteless. I shared a basket of fries with my boyfriend and it was the same thing, tasteless. Everything seemed to be really expensive for what we were getting too. And the ambiance is horrible. So corny, so stiff, just a real bad vibe going down overall for me.

Reviews.Author: jenny t.
Reviews.Content: My first time at Peggy Sue's I ordered a regular hamburger but it wasn't that good and I never had it again.I've had their chicken strips and fish & chips which comes with fries or you can upgrade it with onion rings.At the price you're paying here, especialy in this area, there are no complaints.

Reviews.Author: Jonas C.
Reviews.Content: It's a little more inconvenient for me to go out here, and to be honest, it's been a while since I've been here, but I suppose I should put up a post as well.  Ever since the place on Park matched the menu there isn't much difference save the ambiance.  Where the locale on Park trends towards a more "Johnny Rockets"-type diner look and feel, the San Pedro location to me seems more like a sports bar.  It's pretty dark and crowded inside (which is why I don't give it a 4), but there are TVs around to watch things.  I'd imagine it was originally designed to attract Sharks fans and might get rowdy during games, but I really don't know.  Anyways, that's that.

Reviews.Author: iPunchfish -.
Reviews.Content: This place is a grease pit.

Reviews.Author: Sara B.
Reviews.Content: This was the worst meal I've ever eatin before.  For the price I had to pay, it was riduculous!  I ordered the chicken sandwich with avacado, and it was so bland, not even mustard made it taste any better.  My boyfried ordered the bacon cheeseburger, and he didnt even want to finish it.  The only thing we finished was the chocolate and strawberry milkshakes.  The chocolate one tasted like it was mixed with regular chocolate syrup. Boring.  The curly fries tasted like they get them from Jack In the Box.  If I wanted fast food, I would have gone there instead of paying $4.00 for fries.   The ranch dressing was watered down or something.  And to top everything off, it smelt like a portapotty in the resturaunt.  Not pleasing when your eating or ever!  It was a waste of time and money and I will never eat there again.

Reviews.Author: Andy M.
Reviews.Content: Seriously awful food. Just terrible. The service is great, but that doesn't make up for the food. It's just terrible.

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: Probably as good as I expected. Didn't think it would be great but I was happy with my food. I got a turkey burger and thought it tasted good and was not dry. They have sweet potato fried which is always a plus. My wife got a tuna melt which was just ok. The wait was horrid but then again there was a MNF game and a Sharks game so everywhere had a bad wait.

Reviews.Author: Meryshayne G.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is just alright. I like the way it looks, that 50's diner feel. And I find that I get lost looking at all the memorabilia on the walls and such, but the food is just like any other place. Nothing really falls far from what it is. The bacon burger is a bacon burger and the fries are just fries. It's not bad and it's just okay.

Reviews.Author: Kris T.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's is a great place for a quick burger for lunch/dinner.  It's not the fanciest in town but their food is good nonetheless. If you can, take advantage of their Wednesday lunch special ($6 for any burger with fries and a soda). Also, their breakfast burritos are surprisingly good too.

Reviews.Author: James L.
Reviews.Content: I was starving for a breakfast burrito and decided to drop in and give theirs a try.  It was amazing and hit the spot.  I can't wait for the next one.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Good burgers and awsome milkshakes, especially the pinapple shake. My girlfriend fell in love with the 50's/60's theme. Over all good service and will go back again. They also provide parking validation for the garage across the street.

Reviews.Author: Maddie O.
Reviews.Content: Typical American diner. I love their curly fries , fish&chips , burgers and milkshaaake! But of course, i had better in Johnny Rockets, idk why but johnny rockets burgers are just D double o d good! Im giving this place 4 stars!

Reviews.Author: Vladimir M.
Reviews.Content: I love this place, I've been going here for years and never get sick of it. Great prices,great food and friendly service! You can't beat that!!! Good job!

Reviews.Author: Adam C.
Reviews.Content: Came to this place a few times and the food was alright. Pretty expensive for a burger and Johny Rockets its just right down the street. My girl likes it but its not so great for me.

Reviews.Author: Andrea M.
Reviews.Content: This place is good like the reviews says. I ordered the sputnik because I can never turn down grilled onions. I was surprised when they asked how did I want my burgers because that never occurred to me. So I got a medium rare hamburger with grilled onions. very moist and juicy is all I can say for the copious amounts of napkins I had to use. The mint chip milkshake was good too. Will come again when I get the chance in the future.

Reviews.Author: Josh M.
Reviews.Content: I've been liking this place since i first had it while attending SJSU in 2005.  I started off with the Superman Burger, which is a Swiss Cheeseburger with Bacon, and that is when i knew i was gonna be going back in the foreseeable future.  Every now and then i go back and have the Chili Cheese Dog, one of my personal favorites.  Before you get too excited to get their Chili Cheese Fries, find a person to share it with because there is hella, like "Selena-concert" hella.  The tuna melt is also deeeelish and the strawberry shake has that very classic strawberry shake taste that makes you wanna rock Long TAll Sally by Little Richard.

Reviews.Author: Frankie D.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about! I remembering this place being a lot better? Took a nose dive over the years I guess?  I just felt like something was missing after I finished my burger.. Milkshake was solid but I can't see myself going outta my way to come back!

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: I've only gone here for breakfast, so I can only review based on that. However, the breakfast is quite good. Nothing too special, just your standard breakfast food, but still good and reasonably priced. I do know that this Peggy Sue's serves country potatoes instead of hash browns now, which I frown upon. I know the other location downtown still serves hash browns, so whenever I can, I go to the other one. The bonus about this one is the TV's, so on Saturday/Sunday mornings in the fall, I can have a sit-down breakfast and watch football shows. Gotta stop by sometime for the actual diner food, and not just breakfast.

Reviews.Author: Carol W.
Reviews.Content: We were told this was a good place for breakfast 50's style, but we found it to be tired and unattractive.  Food was ok, orange juice was icky.  Service was friendly.  Eggs were cooked right, but just plopped on a bare plate.  Not that cheap, either.  Won't be back

Reviews.Author: Ariel M.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sue's used to be good. What happened? The food is so overpriced, I got the combo with fries for $5 and we only got a couple fries, McDonald's fries are better. The burgers had no taste. Never coming back!

Reviews.Author: Smeilla B.
Reviews.Content: I printed out the coupon from entertainment.com this morning that was valid from 10/02/2012 thru 10/16/2012, and went there for lunch.  I was told that the ownership has been changed, and they don't honor the coupons from the last owner.  And I was also told that they've posted the ownership change in the newspaper as if it was my bad that I didn't check the paper before I went there.  I don't think I'll ever go there again.  There's other restaurants in San Jose downtown where I'd rather spend my money.

Reviews.Author: Banjo J.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are gross, the food tastes like public school food.

Reviews.Author: Brittany R.
Reviews.Content: Sorry Peggy Sue's, but your burgers have taken a turn for the worse and your staff is seriously creepy. While trying to get me and my dinner date to purchase a massive margarita, the guy at the register felt the need to address our relationship status, not once, but twice. I know it's a small diner, but try to act professional.

Reviews.Author: Lucky Gal ..
Reviews.Content: There's nothing more awkward than walking into a diner-themed restaurant and hearing Mexican music coming from the kitchen.  Of course this is nothing new since we have such a large and growing Hispanic population in San Jose.  Ok, lets get straight to reviewing about the last and only visit I made to Peggy Sue's.  Since it was my first time at PS, I decided to order the Cheeseburger with avocado.  Lets just say that it was one of the most boring burgers I have ever tasted.  I can't believe they pride themselves on being the best burger joints in town.  In-and-Out is way better than this.  It hurt to have paid over $20 for two cheese burgers, one large order of fries, and two solders (came with my hubby).  Not having combo meals for choices didn't help either.  We ordered everything separately.  They only had the Shark special (for hockey fans) but we didn't order that because we wanted a cheese burger with avocado.  It was around $6 for the burger itself!  The only thing I like was the decor.  There was also no ambiance to this location.

Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: It was a pretty slow Monday night when my girl and I decided to stop by for a quick dinner. After deciding what we wanted to eat, we went up to the cashier to order. I could immediately smell the booze off the drunk waiter who took our order. We then seated ourselves in a booth next to the door when 5 teenagers walked in to be seated at the bar. The waiter, whom I soon found out was named Joey due to their loud obnoxious behavior, seemed to be serving alcohol to minors. Not only were they screaming and shouting, they found it entertaining to throw pennies everywhere at each other which undoubtedly found its way toward our direction. The food was a rip off, I felt that if we had gone through a Jack in the Box drive thru we would have been treated with more respect and paid less for better tasting JUNK FOOD.If you ever pass by, NEVER ENTER. The customer service was terrible, as the waiter simply "tossed" the plates on our table letting fries fall right off our plates. Someone should inform authorities about the underage drinking and this Joey character should be fired for his unprofessional and horrible service! Never in my 27 years of life did I ever experience such cheap behavior.

Reviews.Author: kim t.
Reviews.Content: Went here for lunch on a Sunday. We were the 1st ones in the restaurant and we had never been here before.  I wasnt sure if we were suppose to wait to be seated, or seat ourselves or order at the counter and be seated.  The guy at the counter didnt say hi to us, smile or tell us what to do. So anyway, we looked at the menu and I figured we just order it at the counter and then seat ourselves.  I ordered a peggy sues cheeseburger which was dry, nothing fabulous and I think I'd rather have a burger at in n out. At least its juicier!  My hubby ordered a dry steak sandwich which he didn't think was great either.  So a combination of service without a smile and crappy food, we will not be back.

Reviews.Author: Jenny M.
Reviews.Content: ew dont go here. nothing special at ALL about this place. i had a bacon cheeseburger and it really just tasted like something i could have made at home. the patty was overcooked and dry and its just sooo normal. for some reason i was expecting at least some kind of special sauce..but no. and don't get any of the condiments! who knows how long those pickles have been sitting out there. and i had ranch with my curly fries..and the ranch tasted a little sour...GROSS!! i'm assuming its been sitting out there for at least 4 days..dont you have to refrigerate ranch?! i spent $8.41 for a bacon cheeseburger and curly fries...too much for something you can get from a BBQ.

Reviews.Author: S T.
Reviews.Content: This review is for breakfast.  Sadly this is not worth the effort.  I don't know how you mess up breakfast staples and have them taste bland, but that's what they did.  And limp bacon, does anyone like that?

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: ive only had the burgers here, but they were pretty good.  in comparable price it is definently better than johnny rockets.

Reviews.Author: Monica S.
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I were at a music competition at SJSU and decided to do some coupon eating (2 for 1) at Peggy Sues. When I presented the coupon, the cashier said they weren't accepting coupons that day because of the basketball game playing on the TV. Hmmmm. There wasn't that many people eating at the restaurant and those that were, weren't watching the game. One star lost. My patty melt and my friend's burger with jalapeño jack cheese met our expectations, but not the curly fries which were not curly, but skinny sticks. I must have received the bottom of the barrel. Another star lost. Although, my friend did say I was better off with the non-curly curly fries than the onion rings he ordered. My other friend's mocha shake was good, except that Peggy Sues forgot to make it and my friend had to go back and remind them. Maybe they were the ones watching the game. My rejected coupon left me with a sour attitude.

Reviews.Author: Dina S.
Reviews.Content: When I heard about the terrible experience my family had at Peggy Sue's, I had to warn others!!  My husband and two kids decided on Peggy Sue's before the Van Halen concert.  When they got there, the line was pretty long and it took a while to get through the line, maybe 15 minutes.  Apparently, there was an older gentlemen, who appeared to be the owner, not doing a lot of anything, while the son took orders and the wife ran around like a one armed woman in a wallpaper hanging contest trying to fill all the orders.  My husband said that they waited 45 minutes for their food.  They would have left after 30 minutes but felt stuck since others places were probably crowded on a concert night.  While they waited, they started hearing complaints in the crowd.  People, like Jim, another reviewer, were trying to get their money back.  My family said that the food was decent but NEVER AGAIN will they go back here!  Be warned fellow Yelpers!

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Reviews that don't like Peggy Sue's burgers are off, in my opinion. I've never had a bad burger at Peggy Sue's. I started going there before Sharks games when the restaurant was a hole in the wall on East Santa Clara Street.

Reviews.Author: Nicola L.
Reviews.Content: Peggy Sues...Listen up people, if you want a really nice meal, there are plenty of other places in San Jose to go.  If you want decent food, decent prices, quick service and a fun atmosphere, hit up Peggy Sues.  I've been going here for a few years before the Sharks games, and their pre-game drink specials can't be beat.  Where other places charge you $5-7 per pint, Peggy's gives you a great deal ($3 per pint).  Its a great location, and the food is definitely better than most options for the speed/quality/price.

Reviews.Author: Raina P.
Reviews.Content: This place has to be the worse place ive ever eaten!  The food and the service was horrible and I mean NASTY! Burger King has better This place has to be the worse place ive ever eaten!  The food and the service was horrible and I mean NASTY! Burger King has better pattys than they do ! I never knew owners talk crazy infront of the customers to the workers !Snapping his fingers at them ! This place has to be a joke ! His name was Shiraz R Jivani said he owned it for 8 years ! never knew a burger could taste so bad. Never have i ever had to return food! I mean never!  The owner gave me such a hard time he wanted my id to return  said corporate needed it ? Wtf he was so mad that i said the quality of the burger was horrible ! He had people waiting in line he was yelling at kitchen workers to get the Fucken order off the truck ? I mean what kind of place is this ? How can people let their franchise buisness become like this?? wow! Never will we ever walk by this filthy place and spend a Dime!

Reviews.Author: Larry F.
Reviews.Content: We just had an absolutely outstanding experience with Peggy Sue's under it's new ownership.  A year ago we booked the restaurant for a private party of 80 teens for our son's Bar Mitzvah celebration.  Two months prior when we called to discuss details we learned that the restaurant had been sold.  Despite the fact that the new owner was not told of our private party or of the substantial deposit we had paid, he assured us he would honor that contract and would treat our son as his own. That is exactly what he did!  He and his son Saif went out of their way to attend to every detail and to make this party special and memorable.  Our son and his 80 guests LOVED the party.  The owner brought in extra staff and coordinated every detail with us so that all the guests were fed together and the party could run smoothly.  What really added to the fun of the evening was seeing all the Peggy Sue staff rocking out to our DJ behind the counter.  They were having as much fun as we were!  Both the owner and his son were present for our party and worked throughout to ensure it's success.  The owner's son is a true gem!  We have been getting nothing but rave reviews on this party - thanks Peggy Sue's for a wonderful evening.  P.S. Your shakes are the best in town!!!

Reviews.Author: Jay D.
Reviews.Content: ***DO NOT EAT HERE** horrible burger.i ordered the avacado burger and got ONE thin slice of avacado. the lady at the cash register was rude and messed up our order. we said potatoe fries she  gave us regular fries. it was a fun atmoshpere but very crowded. i will never recomend this place or eat here again. the quality of food is definetly low and horrible. the prices are high and you do not get what you pay for. go next door or a few doors down better food.

RestaurantInfo.Name: Peggy Sue’s
RestaurantInfo.Address: 29 N San Pedro StSan Jose, CA 95110
